description:
I come to the Willows on the reg, due to living right next to it. The food here is actually really good, compared to typical bar food. It seems like the kitchen actually put some thought into the menu. I particularly love the vegan sloppy joe's - which do not taste overly vegan. The fish burger is good too - they actually take the time to grill the fish properly.

The vibe is divey but living-room-esque. There is also ample seating so you're not forced to stand around hovering.

My one complaint is that the bartender on the side with the pool table is sometimes in a pissy mood and takes it out on the customers - my friends and I go here pretty often and one night some of us took like a second too long to decide if/how many shots were needed and that pissed him off apparently? Other than that, the rest of the crew is pretty solid.

Protip: kitchen is only open until 11pm, so if you're stumbling home late and looking for food, just remember to get there before 11!
author: Farrah N.

description:
I like it here, the sliders are delicious, they do take out and I've never been met with anything but a smile. Great low-key neighborhood bar, and they have some fun tiki share drinks if you wanna work up to a party attitude. 

The vibe here has changed and the food tasted old. Like it had been in the fridge for too long. Maybe they've been having some bad days, but I don't think I'll return in the near future
author: Evan M.

description: Came here with my manager for a meeting and the food was BOMB! I had the Western Burger with a black bean patty and the flavors were spot on! I'm going to have to come back and try more of their food! Delish!!!
author: Frisco N.

description:
We came here for a company lunch at around 12pm on a Tuesday. The place was pretty empty and we were able to find a large table for everyone to seat.

The waitress was friendly and got us menus and water quickly. 

I must say the food was surprisingly delicious! I had a Grilled Chicken Breast Burger ($10.75). I added a slice of Swiss cheese and a fried egg for a dollar each. The chicken was tender and had a nice Smokey flavor. The buns were huge but they were soft and fluffy. 

I also tried some of the Brussels Sprouts ($7.75). They were not stingy with the portion size. Some fancy places would give you tiny pieces of brussels sprouts and all you can taste is how charred they are. However, not here and I loved it!

We are thinking of coming back here and try The Drunk & Happy Meal, which comes with a burger, fries, a pint of beer, a shot, and a toy! Lol
author: Alice L.

description: I had the fried chicken sandwich once before, the flavors were good, was a decent sandwich on a fresh soft bun. I had delivery of the same today with an order of Assad fries. The only thing edible are the actual French fries. The meat quality here is terrible! The chicken was tough, dry and truly inedible I thought maybe I got a bad bite but I went around the entire thing and finally pulled it out of the bun and felt it, this is hard as a rock. I could barely get a piece bitten off sawing my teeth together! Just inedible! The carne asada was low quality, full of fat and gristle. I ate  enough fries to get some satiety but what a waste of money
author: Piper W.

description: Willows is my favorite place to come on Friday after a long week at work. The food is on point with a nice beer. The carne asada fries are pretty good. The bartender Jason makes some great mixed drinks and always greets his customers with a smile.
author: Simon H.

description: Planned to have an early dinner with a friend, but were unable to get the attention of  the bartender despite standing at the bar for more than five minutes.  Eventually, we were offered menus by another employee, but   when we were told we could place our order with the bartender, based on her attitude, we left.  We'd been told this was a good place for a great hamburger, but maybe not a good place for older customers in light of our treatment.
author: Ellen F.

description: We got a booth for four around 7pm on a Wednesday. They have a weird ordering system that took a while for my boyfriend to figure out. The pork belly donuts are just as good as at the Sycamore. I got the Lamb Burger (4 stars) - it was greasy but tasted good!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
This second review is for brunch. While the Willows is great for beer, it's really not that great for food.

I stopped by with a friend and got the carne asada scramble. Let's just say the food was underwhelming and that the eggs were over cooked and bland. I paid extra for guacamole and they gave like a tablespoon of it - totally not worth the price. I feel like I could probably do better myself... 

I think the Willows are great for hanging out with friends but don't be expecting too much on the food.
author: Liza X.

description:
Quiz night Wednesdays: this pub has regular weekday events such as pub quiz Wednesday's as well as live DJ thursdays. 

First time here with a friend, it's a very casual almost dive-y bar for reasonably priced after work drinks: lots of craft beers and even whiskeys, but I don't see any wines which is my normal booze of choice. 

My long time customer friend mentioned that the bartender is one of the least friendliest he has encountered in town. But he still comes back so I guess service is not bad enough to deter him. 

Pub quizzes can get a bit noisy. The quiz master Steve tends to drag the night on especially after first two rounds, more drinks to be had...

We ordered a patty melt, which was not bad although a bit greasy. Food here seems to be pretty average pub grub. 

2 Stars as I didn't find the place very comfortable with bad service and a rather rowdy crowd, but if you're looking for a casual dive bar and don't mind the noise, it could be more enjoyable...perhaps I just didn't drink enough!
author: Fiona F.

description: Wow!!! Just happened to come across this place!!! Best burger and garlic fries i have ever had!!!! Lucas did not exaggerate about how good the food was!!! Burger lover's have to come here!!!!
author: Edward H.

description:
On the cusp of the SOMA before heading into the mission The Willows is a great spot to get a shot, a beer, and a damn good burger.  With patty options from waygu beef to a vegan black bean patty with a vegan bun they have food for everyone.

My last visit here I came in for a late lunch.  Josh, the bartender behind their main bar. He was more than knowledgeable about their food menu as well as his spirits.  I was impressed with how he balanced his customer service at the bar while also serving the seated table efficiently. He was friendly and let me know about the specials when I sat down.

Would definitely recommend sitting at the bar when he's working if you want some laughs and knowledge on liquor.
author: Patrick H.

description:
Cool bar with surprisingly yummy brunch!

My friends & I visited here when we were looking for a brunch place to hit up before the Dubz art exhibit. A bar that hosts brunch, who knew!

We started our meal with bottomless mimosas. The waiters/bartenders were quick to refill your glass when it starts to get empty. Appreciated that! The food itself took a while to come out but it did not disappoint. I ordered the biscuits & gravy and added bacon on the side. You have to hit a $10 minimum on food to get the bottomless mimosa deal. So adding the bacon took my meal right above $10. I believe the biscuits are made in house. They were warm, fluffy & delicious!! The gravy was also really good. The only con was the potatoes were a little burnt, but still edible! From what I can tell, it had good flavor.

Overall, I'm happy I stumbled upon this place. Will definitely come back & visit whenever I'm in the area!
author: Andrea F.

description:
I absolutely love this place; it's eclectic, offers a wide variety of...everything, and has sassy waitresses that aren't afraid to chat and exchange witty remarks! We started out with bottomless mimosas and bottomless bloody marys (yes yes yes bottomless is the way to go!!!!) then we transitioned to more drinks. Here's a list of what we got:

Mimosa: Yum; better than your average Cook's and cheap OJ kinda deal. Definitely a winner.

Bloody Mary: Light on the alcohol, but I prefer it that way if I'm going to be inhaling bottomless ones...great flavor and adds a good amount of spicy kick to your taste buds!

Scorpion bowl: The complete opposite of my bloody mary. This is meant to kick you in the face and get you hammered FAST!! Definitely got a good amount of alcohol here--not that any of us were complaining. I think this bowl is meant for 4, but 2 can have a great time with one of these ;) 

Hangover meal: Their homemade biscuits are delicious, and even more so with sausage and bacon! I don't really think it needed the mayo, but everything else was on point! The fruit was also very fresh and the potatoes (with the exception of a couple burnt/toasty ones) had amazing flavor!

Carne asada scramble with guac: I actually don't think this dish needed the guac (extra charge), even though it was very tasty guac indeed. I really enjoyed the large amounts of carne asada, and it went very well with the cheese and eggs. Maybe I'll go all out and add a biscuit to this next time.

Fries: Great for the drunchies. These fries are very salty, and some were slightly limp (I actually don't like super crunchy fries though), so it was exactly the way I liked it. They also give you a giant basket of these, so make sure you share!

Overall, YES, I'd love to come here again! I waddled out stuffed to the brim with delicious food and alcohol, and there are so many more things I want to try on the menu (and at the bar!) Definitely give this place a try!
author: Monica L.

description: I like Willows. Been here twice when I came to SF to watch bands. Dive bar with big windows to people watch. They do have TVs and a pool table. Friendly vibe even though the bartender seemed a little exhausted, understandable. Got me a PBR and some sliders. Pretty dang good sliders. Music was a hit for me. They played The Cure and some Morrissey. Slick. Definitely be hitting this place more.
author: Joe M.

description:
The food was good but the staff was outstanding! So friendly and accommodating. Service was top notch  And let me add that they were on point with their bottomless mimosas! I never ran out! Unbeatable deal. Love the energy from this place. 
I recommend missionary style brunch. More than filling!
author: Lyndon G.

description:
I had the worst experience at this establishment. It was so bad that after 1.5 hours I had to cancel my order and walk away.  Everyone else in our party got their food--burgers, fries, chicken nuggets. Our food, it was an order for 3, a burger, carne asada fries, and wings never came out.  When I asked the associate Gabe for help, he yelled at me, "I know you're 45 and your food isn't up!" He offered no help nor to check on why our good was taking so long. He was rude and totally a disgrace to the restaurant profession. When one of my WHITE friends went to ask for the order they were treated very different than me and told they would check on that. And when I went with my other friend to cancel the order, then miraculously our order appeared.  

My frustration with The Willows aside from the unacceptable service is the treatment I received. I am not sure if it was because I am Latino or because I am gay or simply because I was not white. When I went to check in my order, after and hour waiting, I was not met with helpful service but attitude and disdain.  The only excuse I received was that the kitchen was backed up--but how backed up could it be when our friends and tables around us got their food? 

I will never enter this establishment again and I will make sure everyone I know understands what a sub professional restaurant The Willows is and to avoid it.
author: Carlos S.

description: This is a great little neighborhood bar and grill.  Everything they do there, they do extremely well.  It is comfortable and relaxed.  Fabulous place to spend the day playing pool or assorted board games.  All of the food is tasty and the the drink specials, adventurous.
author: Matthew D.

description: Great spot to grab a drink and a bite to eat. It's not amazing gourmet, but the kitchen will make you something you'll like and it's tasty. There's a grown up happy meal that comes with burgers, a side like fries, a shot of whiskey, and a beer. :) depending on who you are that can make you happy. Service at the bar is great. You order at the bar and get a number for food to be delivered to you.
author: Mary M.

description: Great neighborhood handout - the bar is very low key and casual and the bar food is yummy.   They are good neighbors.
author: Gary B.

description: I go to Willows periodically with friends from work. I like that we are usually always able to find a place to sit even with a bunch of us. There are two bars which keep people separated and from what I've seen, the bartenders are great, so tip them well!  I haven't tried the food yet but I did smell the burgers and it sure smelled delicious!  Great place for groups and not too loud so you can hear each other.
author: Paul S.

description: Good beer and nice burgers and sandwiches.  I got the fried chicken sandwich and really liked it.  Next time i want to get the happy drunk meal.
author: Michael E.

description:
3.75

Walked in, friends were nowhere to be found.  Walked toward the bar and noticed another room on my left.  Oh hey.

Very dive bar-esque.  There were tools and ladders, and bags all over the place.  While we were looking through the menu, a gentleman was hanging up a frame while two ladies watched him making sure it was properly hung.  Uhh, should we be here?

Surprisingly, they have 805, woot.

While we waited for the pool table to open up, we decided to rummage through the old board games stored on the shelves along the walls.  After dominating in scrabble, woot, the pool table finally opened up.   After dominating in pool, woot, we decided to play one more game before heading out.  

What is one thing a person can do to prevent pregnancy?  Stick it in the butt!  WOW.  You win bro, game over.

Kudos for providing fun games.
author: Linda N.

description:
GROSS EGGS!!

Went here with some friends to grab brunch and partake in bottomless mimosas. When we arrived a little before noon on a Saturday, the place was pretty much empty, save for a few tables. I guess that should have been a sign.

Anyways, we went ahead and ordered and most of us opted for the bottomless mimosa option with our meal.

For my meal, I decided to go with the Shakshuka--a dish that I have grown to love over the last year. Several others ordered it as well because it sounded so good.

Needless to say, all of ours came out around the same time and we all sort of stared at the plate with a little bit of horror. The eggs looked as if they had once been plastic and were just heated up and put on the skillet. I don't know how you make eggs look that inedible, but they did. I was so hungry I just cut it up and mixed it around and made due, but my other friends opted to have it remade. When they brought them back out, they looked pretty much the same, so my friends stomached as much of it as they could.

The woman who was waiting on us was decently friendly and apologized saying that they had relatively new kitchen staff, but the food was just so appalling--especially for something as simple as over easy eggs.

I don't know what this place is like for everything other than brunch, but do yourself a favor and steer clear of the eggs here, especially from the Shakshuka.
author: Ryan R.

description:
Josh is the god damn man. 

Make sure you stop by for some good drinks, conversation and most importantly board games!!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
This is by far my favorite bar in San Francisco. They have a great beer selection, wonderful cocktails, and one of the best burgers in SF! Don't worry if you're not a meat eater, I really can't recommend the veggie sloppy joe enough (add some onion strings for an extra salty crunch). 

The crowd at the Willows is chill and the staff is friendly and very welcoming. It's a great place to meet-up with friends, play a board game, shoot some pool, and feel like a regular even if it's your first visit. Make sure to check out the awesome events they have every night of the week, like trivia night on Wednesdays. You'll have a blast. 

The Willows is my San Francisco home, and just like home, they never let me see the bottom of my mimosa glass. Cheers!
author: Rob M.

description: In the process of getting buttered up around the corner at Butter, I needed a solo break and a bite. This was the perfect spot. The Willows is a casual, neighborhood bar with atmosphere to match. They didn't even bat an eye when I walked in wearing my Star Trek TOS garb. Ordered a PBR and a couple sliders. I'm like really into sliders, so much so I dream of opening my own dive bar/food joint with a menu that features mostly sliders. I think I might name this spot Sliders. (That name kind of sucks, actually, so maybe not.) Back to the Willows, well, they delivered on their sliders. I had one veggie and one beef. So good I wouldn't even risk getting any drippings on my Spock Mock.
author: Will S.

description: I love the carne Asada fries! Reminds me of home in San Diego. I love the sour berry beer they have its worth trying at least once.
author: Donte' G.

description:
They have happy hour all day on Sundays on both food and drinks. 

The wait staff was prompt and friendly. The bartender in the full bar was a little rattled by having 20 people in his bar at one time and kept getting flustered with my friends and I who made up about half of the bar when we came in for post Pride food and drinks.  

When the water was empty, I notified the bartender. He rudely told me that obviously they were busy. I retorted that it wasn't obvious to me since I'm from NYC. He didn't like that, so he poured me water from behind the bar and slammed it onto the bar, splashing water on me and my friend.  

I had the burger and couldn't finish it. It was a solid burger, cooked to order. The fried pickles were good too.

Despite the rough start, we all had a blast, with drinks and food served promptly and plenty of seating for a large group.
author: Monique S.

description: I can't decide if I want to suggest that you come here..or not. Because I love that I don't have to wait for a table...but I also want to make sure this incredible spot stays for many years to come. Shoottt. I'd wait hours for the hangover sandy. Who am I kidding?!!
author: sara m.

description:
Ordered the food and waited in my car and then went in a few minutes early to find out that my food had not been processed by them and they said it doesn't work. 
So then I ordered and waited another 20-25 minutes 
Got my food and it was average at best 
Overly salty burger no flavor 
Won't be trying this dive again
author: Davis M.

description:
Jamie W. and I are not barhoppers by any stretch, but we happen to be in the area after a memorial service we attended at Slim's for a beloved neighborhood activist. We were feeling peckish, and I had heard good things about the Willows, a space I had not been to since the old Hamburger Mary's days. When we entered, it was fairly quiet at around 7PM, surprising since SoMa is known for its crowded watering holes no matter what the hour. We initially parked ourselves at the side bar in the middle room where the pool tables are and started perusing the menu. They offered quite a robust selection of goodies.

There were temptations bordering on absurd like Pork Belly Donuts and Fried Chicken Sliders, and believe you me, they were under serious consideration. However, common sense washed over us like the loose urinary tract of a moose, and consequently we went with salads albeit big ones. Jamie ordered the $12.75 Cobb Salad, which brought together green leaf lettuce, chopped bacon, fried chicken slabs, blue cheese crumbles, tomatoes and cucumbers into a symphony of healthy tastiness as it was tossed in a tarragon vinaigrette dressing (photo: http://bit.ly/1PcV5Il). It was quite a hefty bowl to come out of a bar kitchen.

I was in the mood for kale and went with the $11.75 Kale Greek Salad which came with tomatoes, red onion, pepperoncinis, cucumbers, olives and crumbled feta cheese, all of that tossed liberally in extra virgin olive oil and lemon juice (photo: http://bit.ly/20aSdNQ). It was really well executed, and while we ate our salads at a communal table already inhabited by a trio of laptoppers who never looked up, the vibe was low-key enough for us to eat in relative peace. We weren't completely healthy, by the way, as we shared the $5.75 Basket of Onion Strings with Chipotle Aioli, addictive crispy greasiness that reminded us that we were indeed in a bar (photo: http://bit.ly/1OCtYB4).

FOOD - 4 stars...surprisingly good and hearty salads for pure bar bites
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...spacious, low-key bar could provide a leisurely afternoon hangout
SERVICE - 3 stars...the food certainly came fast enough
TOTAL - 4 stars...overlook the hipsters and come for a bite
author: Ed U.

description:
Wanted to find a bar with reasonably priced drinks AND food. Was recommended to The Willows by a friend. 

Headed over on a Friday Night around 7pm. So it is Friday, so it was quite busy in the main room, but the back more "restaurant" cafeteria style room was pretty spacious. However, a lot of the tables were dirty and food sat on them for awhile after people left. 

My friend and I sat at the bar and stared at the bartenders for at least 10 minutes while people behind us were being served and people were literally reaching over us to get their drinks before we were served. This happened each drink we ordered. 

The food was "meh." Their fried chicken sliders at $3.75 were the size of half my hand and were dry, not very satisfying. I also received an eyeroll when I ordered a jack and coke (a pretty normal drink).

I would normally give this place 2 stars on service alone but the drinks were a good price.
author: Crystal A.

description:
Came here on a Sunday and it was awesome. Not too crowded, but not dead either. I was hoping the basketball game would be on but they didn't seem to have any TVs but it was all good. 

I was really intrigued by the pork belly donuts but decided to skip them and try them on a future visit. The bottomless mimosas are only $12.50 (with food purchase) and they are seriously bottomless- my glass was always refilled quickly without asking. 

Got the biscuits and gravy with a side of bacon and it was awesome. Huge home made biscuits plus creamy sausage gravy. The potatoes on the side were nicely seasoned and crispy- it is sad how many places mess up breakfast potatoes and make them either bland or soggy, but these were great. The bacon was alright- nothing too noteworthy but its bacon so nothing to complain about either. My small complaints would be that after a while, the food did get on the salty side and the sausage gravy had a little too much pepper for my taste. But overall, an awesome spot. 

Their menu during the week looks equally interesting and they have a nice cocktails list plus daily specials AND 15 beers on tap! There's even a separate craft beer bar (that was closed on Sunday I think). I am sure I will be back for brunch, and maybe during the week as well. Overall a good spot with solid drinks and a great menu.
author: Seema U.

description:
I am not exaggerating - we waited one hour for a burger here. That's one hour AFTER placing our order! And on a weekday, no less. 

After grabbing drinks nearby my coworkers and I wanted to grab something to eat, and one of my friends mentioned getting some good grub at The Willows before. We placed our orders quickly enough with the bartender, and grabbed a table. One of my coworkers' chicken nuggets and fries came out after about 15 minutes, and then a full 25 minutes later my order of sliders and fries came out. The worst part is the rest of our party ordered a burger and chicken nuggets, but only their nuggets came out. When they inquired about their burger the server went to go check, and the burger came out another 20 minutes after. And I'm not making these times up - I checked my phone and had texted my boyfriend while they ordered the burger at 8:07 PM. The burger came out at 9:00 PM.  

I get that they're busy but it's clear there's some organization that needs to be done. It doesn't take that long to make a burger, and they should have expedited the order once our server found out we were missing an item. Instead it seems like they put it in queue with all the orders before it. 

Our server was very apologetic about the ordeal, but after that wait I'm not sure I'd risk ordering food here.
author: Angela L.

description: Great food and excellent customer service. First attempted to get delivery to my hotel via UberEats but the driver misdelivered it whoknowswhere. I called up and the manager was very understanding and remade my order promptly and even contacted me after to doublecheck and make sure I received my order the next time. I really appreciated that she worked with UberEats to ensure I received a refund for first delivery that I didnt receive. Worth the wait and a quality fried chicken burger meal. If I have a chance to back nice time I'm visiting here I surely will.
author: Jenn K.

description: I can not explain to the world how much I love this place I've been coming here for years and it's very rare that I've had bad service (everyone is allowed to have a bad day) any time I have friends come visit the city I always make sure we hit up Willows! Seriously feels like I get a home cooked meal every time I visit keep up the good work people could be the best food at any bar in town I moved away from this area now live by union square I wish u guys would move with me
author: David J.

description:
Cool decent sized bar. Crowd was not that crazy on a Friday night. A lot of seating. Bartenders were quick to serve, probably because it was not that packed. Great beer selection. Prices were reasonable. It was a good lively place to hang out on a Friday night.

Einstock Bottle Beer - $6.50
Draft Beer - $5.50
author: Kevin W.

description:
I was really surprised at how good the vegetarian food was here. We came for an SF Beer Week event, and quickly grabbed some of their vegan sloppy joes to settle our stomach before the drinking began.

The texture & flavor were spot-on. It was everything I remember about sloppy joes from my childhood. They will even serve it over fries (instead of their pulled pork fries) if you want to give up any remaining shreds of health-consciousness.

Their beer selection was also pretty exciting. They had one special bottle pour (Rare Bourbon County Stout) that I'll remember for years.
author: Chris M.

description: I went during pride weekend on Sunday evening, so, my experience there may not be the norm. The place was a bit grungy but festive and even dramatic (a patron got into a yelling math with one of the workers). Ordering food took a LONG time, like 20min of standing by the bar. The food was tasty, though. I got a veggie burger, fries, and cider. I'd have to try this place again on a regular day.
author: Aeon N.

description: Came here for bottomless mimosas for brunch on a Saturday. Our group got there just as they were opening, so there was no line. I ordered a Hangover Sandwich, which came fairly quickly w friendly service. It came with potatoes and a side of fruit. The food and mimosas were very mediocre. The biscuit was buttery and fluffy but the bacon was dry and the eggs slightly under seasoned. Overall, the breakfast food wasn't terrible, but nothing worth coming back for. However, with a great staff and just $12.50 for unlimited drinks, I don't regret checking this place out.
author: Sherrie Y.

description: Upgrading this to a five star joint they have really good wifi.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
I peeped in from the outside, loved the interior and music.  First timer and asked if I order from the bartender or if anybody came to my table.  Bartender glared at me for a while before he said from him but he wasn't ready, not sure what he meant - there were other people eating already so I'm guessing the kitchen had been open for a while.  Took my order and after paying and realizing I forgot to sign I asked for a pen, he glared once again and just plain condescending the whole time.   The food was okay and the lady who brought out our food was delightful.   Bartender seemed happy to help everybody but me so I will keep comin back because I'm sure he'd be glad if I didn't.

Fun University.

(:
author: Ray S.

description:
Great bar; see Tom for a beer! 

Trivia on Wednesdays is a lot of fun! The cocktails are not so great but the food is! 

Play a game of pool or read a book!
author: Evin W.

description: I've been back here several times since my initial review.  It seems like my bad experience was an anomaly, and everything has been great since then.  This place has a good beer selection, fun vibe, and lots of games to play.
author: vlad k.

description:
TLDR; an amazing bar where you feel like you've stumbled into the adventures of Narnia

-

You've been watching HBO's hit series, Westworld, a show based off the premise of what would happen if the cast of Chucky Cheese animatronics came to life and got real drunk. The series makes the viewer grapple with deep philosophical questions such as the origin of consciousness and where one draws the line between human and artificial cognition and intelligence - is there a difference and at what point do we grant "humanity?"

Since watching the show, you've suspected your roommate, Christian Lighting, the two-time felon, part-time improviser, and street magician that almost got you busted for smoking meth in his 84' Ford Econoline van (http://bit.ly/2jQBaEK), to be an AI-powered cyborg.  
  
You need to test your theory. 

Hold your iPad close to his face while Candy Crush is on and command him to clean your room. 
 
"What," he says. "In the living fuck. Are you talking about?"

"Have you ever questioned the nature of your reality?" you ask.

"Again." he says. "What. In the mother fuck. Are you talking about?"

"Soon this will feel like a distant dream. Until then, may you rest in a deep and dreamless slumber," you say as you try to brush his eyelids closed with your fingertips. 

He punches you in the mouth, which you are pretty sure violates some sort of robot protocol. 
 
Because he is not a real human being hit him in the head with your iPad, repeatedly. 
 
You find that the inside of his skull contains a human brain and not a micro-processor as you expected.  

"A rose is a rose," you say, as you tape a dandelion to your dead roommates head and toss his body into the bay. 

"Goddamn robots."

-
Gaze upon the hundreds of tap heads thrust upon the back wall that gives this place a sense of history. Take in the unique nature of this bar and how it makes everyone feel welcome.
author: Dave G.

description: Great place with friendly bartenders, great drinks and food and plenty of space.  Good for groups.
author: a f.

description:
I really like the Willows most of the time and I find myself frequenting this bar. However I keep having run ins with one of the bartenders (middle aged bald guy) - who is the one that keeps coming up in these comments as lacking all courtesy. If you have questions about the bar, the food or the drinks he won't answer them. Then last week, only two days after the season was released he played the first episode of Stranger Things on the TV even after I asked him not to - he told me to go somewhere else. For the life of me I can't figure out how he still has a job (unless he owns the place). 

The reasons that I like this bar and will almost definitely go back (in the hopes that the bartender is no longer there): The beer bar has a great selection that includes Michigan beers most months, they have a nice selection of board games and the self selecting crowd of folks that show up are friendly and interesting.
author: Jeremy K.

description:
How can a great bar can be ruined? Easy - add crappy bartenders. As per San Francisco custom, bartenders here are entitled, arrogant nincompoops not familiar with a concept of customer service whatsoever. But who cares? They all seem to be friends with the management and their main priority is chatting with regulars and their friends. 

Strangely, this does not apply to food servers. They are surprisingly polite and fast. Go figure, and they don't even get tips as all they do is bring you the food ordered at the bar. Burgers are good here. 

Another thing: when I say "great bar", I only mean one half of The Willows, the beer tap room. The other part, the so-called pool room, is your typical dive with absolutely nothing worthy of a visit. If I was to review that one, it would receive one star. Why the two completely different rooms are tied into one bar is a mystery to me.
author: Evg R.

description:
They're always throwing cool events here. The beer is always tasty and they take credit, so I can't complain. The food is actually pretty good, too. 

One time, I won a set of Dogfish Head goblets by yelling out, "RICKY LAKE!"

That only occurs at the best place ever: The Willows!

Next time, I'm going to shout-out "Maury Povich" just to see what ends up happening. Hope I'm not the father!
author: Aren A.

description: I went there on pride afternoon by chance with no idea. They had very good music, good food and yummy cocktails. I will definitely go The Willows again.
author: Simbel G.

description:
This is a good place to hangout and grab lunch or drinks.  There are plenty of options for entrees (e.g., burgers) and snacks (e.g., pork belly donuts)  that have large portions.  You can even get grilled cheese sandwiches as buns.

Service is fast, friendly, and helpful.  It's within walking distance of public transit if you don't want to park on the streets.  There are two areas to eat and hangout including one with billiards.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Came here with a friend who works in the area. It's a short walk from the Van Ness Muni station which is nice. I'm definitely not a big weekday drinker but they have some nice beers and ciders on tap. As decorations they've got some of their beer tap handles on the wall - it's pretty cool. 

We ended up sharing a plate of carne asada fries which I haven't had in months. I always try and get some when I go home to SoCal but have rarely found them up here. Regardless they were decent. Obviously not the best I've ever had but then again how can you really mess up on carne asada fries. 

Protip: the entrance is on the Folsom side. Also on the other side of the bar, they have a pool table and some pinball machines.
author: Nina Y.

description:
My boo used to live close by and a couple friends still do, so I've been here for many brunches and after-work dinner and drinks. Service has always been fine to excellent, crispy fries, crispy fried chicken, bomb roasted Brussel sprouts, super fresh salads, decently stuffed drinks, juicy burgers. 

They change things around a lot so sometimes items fall off the menu or they may or may not have a custom cocktails list up in the bar. 

Queer friendly, attracting more queer clientele recently it seems. Gender neutral bathrooms = half the wait. :)
author: Agnes C.

description: There are so many great things about this bar: the open, airy room flanked with windows and the darker divey room next to it; the staff are absolute sweethearts; healthy options in the large menu; mellow atmosphere compared to the crazy clubs lining the surrounding neighborhood.  I only have one recommendation to the owner: please get more wines (and bigger wine glasses).
author: Priya R.

description: Guy bartender will ignore you if you are a woman  during a sports game. Or whenever. "Because of the rush, you know?"
author: Tess P.

description:
Solid weekday lunch in a hip spot.  Carne Asada Fries were recommended and lived up to expectations.   I visited early afternoon, so fast and friendly service with a few other groups eating there as well.

Definitely will return!
author: Jay S.

description:
Food is good, service is slow. 

Waited 30 minutes for a burger and fries today, was told 10 minutes, did not have time to eat it as I had a flight to catch.
author: Chris B.

description:
The Willows has 12 beers on draft , lunch menu, and regular menu..
lots of hard liquor, cocktails too. small bar seating menu, many tables near the windows

eats: DIY burger (lunch 9.5)
-pickle, mustard, lettuce, tomato on soft bun
-ordered med. rare, came out med. slightly gristly
-meat juice tastable, if it were med. rare, it would be fab. wasn't, some gristle issue
3ish

crumbs:
-cool bartender
-pricey for a burger with no fries, burger best of the average burgers
4 stars for the bartender. smoothed out my uneven day.....cheerful........personable.
author: Victor G.

description: Jacked up Bar Food, 7-Eleven nachos (round chips)* saggy ass french fries- burnt hot dogs with dry bun* Small drinks specials, cash for food*  don't expect too much!!!
author: Edmen M.

description:
Pork belly donuts?!!! I was intrigued. These donuts are really battered chunks of fatty pork belly, in theory delicious but actually lacking in seasoning. 

The chili cheese fries were pretty good but again nothing special. 

They have a happy hour which ends at 7pm (not bad!) but even without the discount the prices are very reasonable. Note they have 2 sections of the restaurant, one serves beer wine and food and the other side serves cocktails. Order on the right side, get a number and find a table. 

Enjoy!
author: Jess C.

description:
Come for drinks and food during happy hour, sticking around to participate in trivia is questionable.

Per a recommendation of a co-worker, a group of four headed to The Willows after work on Wednesday. On our minds? Beer, a stiff cocktail, and non-healthy food. The Willows meets all of these requirements AND plays some pretty awesome music while you wait.

The good:
+ Two bars! One serving craft beer and another with the hard stuff.
+ Fried mac 'n' cheese balls - way better than the stuff you have at TGI Friday's!
+ Mix 'n' match sliders, go for the fried chicken.
+ Comfy seating, good for smaller groups.
+ Pool table and board games handy for those who need to be entertained. 

Not so good:
+ Trivia - we were temped to stick around and give it a go, as the four of us were truly intrigued. Not terribly impressed with the questions, the other players, and how it's managed. And no, we're not hardcore trivia buffs by any means, just like to play a fair game with a host who doesn't seem so scattered.

Overall, The Willows is a great new hangout in SoMa and I hope they stick around!
author: Abby S.

description:
A warm and friendly little gathering spot in SoMa. I stopped in for an evening of booze, burgers and brains (trivia) with some co-workers and was overall very impressed. 

What excited me the most was two-fold. First, the separate bar specializing in craft beers featured a fantastic selection, making for some satisfactory head nods with every new brew I ordered. Second, I love their menu, which had me salivating before ever trying the food. I settled on a DIY burger which comes with lettuce, vine ripe tomato, pickles and mayo. I added some cheddar and caramelized onions. For some reason I thought this would be just another bar where the menu was too clever and health-oriented for its own good, but the burger, like everything else, was clearly designed for someone who loves flavor over concerns about getting fat. 

The only downside was the service. We sat at our table for what must have been 30 minutes before figuring out ourselves that our orders must be placed at the bar. The waiter pretty much ignored us except when bringing out food, and even then he had no idea who ordered what. I ordered my burger with the salt and pepper fries but got regular ones, though they were still damn tasty. 

Tip: Be sure to stop in for trivia Wednesday nights after 7 pm. We scored second place!
author: Alex L.

description:
Situation:
- Almanac tasting on a Thursday evening

Pros:
- Great service
- Great beer options
- Nice decor
- Takes credit cards
- Awesome Happy Hour

Overall
I just had gone for happy hour, but I'd definitely go back and perhaps try the food this time around.
author: Dipesh G.

description:
Come here for the drinks! (Great Draft selection)

Settle in here for the food! (Those fried brussel sprouts...mmmm)

Stay here for Trivia Nights on Wednesdays! (May the best team prevail!)

--------------
There are a few vegetarian options I saw on the menu, but did not inquire whethere they were vegan-friendly or not.
It's a pretty large space, but seats get filled up quickly and can be hard to find a place to sit down.
Bartenders are friendly & awesome.

As for Trivia? Our team started out strong with a 1st Place standing after the first 2 rounds. We were doing really well and feeling like winners until we got to the section on Women's History. Those were some obscure questions!
 I know some of you guys are cheating and using Google. There's no way you can score 8/8 on so many roungs. Our team ended up placing 5th that night with No Cheating! 

Still feeling like winners, we down the rest of our beers and vow to return for another rematch! Anyone down to take us on??
author: Lanie L.

description:
This place has to be one of my new favorite bars. Speaking as a person who generally does not enjoy the bar/drinking scene, this bar rocked my world. They've got pool, shooting, and pinball games, and the atmosphere is extremely chill and laid back. Yeah, not at all like those FiDi stuffy pinky-up bars at all.

What's more amazing is that the bar food they serve here is pretty bombtastic! The pork belly donuts were good, the buffalo wings were good, and my favorite dish of the night were the deep fried mac and cheese. It was definitely done right. I'm not sure if they have sriracha there, but admittedly as sriracha addicts we had our own bottle with us and the Mac and cheese was great with it.

This bar also gets credit for taking away my blowjob virginity - finally. I could have chosen no better bar or night to lose it to. The bartender Showa (sorry if I am butchering it) agreed to make some blowjobs for us even though she had not made them before and she even went into the back room to find glasses we could attempt to fit our mouths around. The effort to make my first blowjob great was definitely appreciated. We ended up taking a blowjob shot with two of the bartenders at the end of the night... just because they seemed like cool people.

Oh, and they serve this alcoholic ginger beer there that is damn tasty.

Overall, the vibes were great, the drinks were great, and the food was great. A night well done and I would definitely come back here again. Cheers!
author: Joanne Y.

description:
#7
I had such a great time at the Willows!

My friend and I were in the city visiting a BFF of mine, David, and we were all super hungry.  David suggested the Willows, I love it, but my other friend had not been before--but he was hungry and really did not care, "Just feed me," he said.  

We walked one block to the tavern.  They were really crowded but we found three unoccupied stools.  The bartender came right over to greet us, placing bev naps in front of us and offering beverages, starters, etc.  He also handed us some food menus so we could figure out how to solve our hunger problem while we waited for our drinks.  

I decided on a black bean burger--one of the BEST I have ever had!  David grabbed a basket of salt and pepper fries and our other friend ordered some mozzarella sticks.  

The black bean burger was so delicious, and every bite was exquisite.  (I am getting hungry right now thinking about it!). It was served with a tiny little salad on the side which complimented the burger perfectly.  The salt and pepper fries were crispy and amazing.  Sometimes, a huge basket of fries is kinda good, some burned and some soggy--not at the Willows--every fry was crispy, salty and peppery...yummie!  The fried mozzarella sticks were terrific as well.  Crispy and full of melted mozzarella.  They were exceptionally large for cheese sticks too.  

Needless to say, after all that food we were extremely full, almost to the point of being uncomfortable!  We played Trivia Crack at the bar and while there is no reason to embarrass anyone--I killed it!!!

The service was wonderful.  The food was marvelous.  The drinks were great.  No complaints whatsoever.  We had a really great time just visiting and playing games.  

Stephani Smiles for The Willows ;)
author: Stephani M.

description: Came to SF on a Sunday with no expectations.  Well an expectation that fell through and then the unexpected happened.  Came to the Willows in the afternoon and there is plenty of street parking nearby.  Plenty enough being that it is San Francisco and usually there is NONE! Back to the Willows, we shared a burger and each had a beer.  I loved that they had quite the variety of beer for both my BF and I.  After all they do say that opposites attract.  The burger was delicious. The beer complimented it. Willows won a piece of my heart that day and I'd return next time I'm in the city.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Popped in on Sunday for a lunch to go, and tried their brunch menu. 
I was greeted right away, the gentleman at the counter put my order in asap. He was very friendly and kind, keeping a light conversation as he worked. By the time I left, every employee saw had said hello, offered to refill my drink, and said thank you. This is the most polite place I've been to in the city - lovely servers.
I had a sausage/bacon breakfast sandwich. It was very tasty, the sausage was not dry at all (kudos to the kitchen, they were a bit busy). It came with potatoes and a fruit bowl: the potatoes were nicely done, and the fruit bowl (melon/pineapple/grapefruit) was not your typical - I really enjoyed it. 
I also liked the decor - simple, complementary colors; dark woods; beautiful textured ceiling - a lovely detail that many establishments do not have.
Thanks for a quick, lovely brunch and a kind conversation!
author: Evan Q.

description:
I visited The Willows on a night out with the guys for our monthly dinner and had high hopes for the food and drinks here based upon what I had been reading on Yelp.  Unfortunately The Willows was a disappointment on pretty much all fronts, and it wasn't until I checked my credit card statement that I realized how shady the bartenders here can be.

I bought a round of drinks for myself and the guys and instead of being charged for 3 drinks, I was charged for 5.  I complained and they fixed the problem, but ended up increasing their tip (one they didn't deserve in the first place) by 50%.  At $12/drink, these were the least special cocktails I've ever had and I will definitely not be back.  The bartender I dealt will was a total jerk and I would be wary of using your credit card here.  Check your statement and make sure you weren't overcharged!

The food is very much overrated and there's not a whole lot to say about their bacon donuts, burgers, or any other menu item except that it's way overpriced and overrated.  For the same price, definitely check out The Chairman truck and grab a bao instead.

Food: 2/10

Service: 0/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 4/10
author: Joe M.

description:
I love this bar. I was here on 5/7/2014 for trivia night and we won second place. Unfortunately I came back today (1 year 10 months later) and they will not honor my 2nd place finish.
WARNING! THEY DO NOT HONOR THEIR TRIVIA NIGHT WINNINGS. I will never come here again. Congratulations you got $50 out of me but lost my business forever, congrats!
author: July C.

description: Josh is a rad bartender, and I will be back because of his extensive knowledge of the menu and spirits. Had a blast!
author: Tom K.

description:
Dastardly dashing handsome companion and I stopped in on a Sunday night. Desolate crowd, but I can see how it would be a fun ambiance during the day. 

Pros:
*Kitchen open at 10PM on a Sunday evening. (HUGE PRO). C'mon San Francisco, you're not Kenosha, WI. Why do you shut down so early????
*Addams Family pinball game seemed to be complimentary, or maybe we were just lucky.

Cons:
*Simpsons pinball machine was busted. Quarter stuck in slot. DOH! 90's kid here, Simpsons vs. Addams Family . . . Simpsons trumps and smokes it off each and every time. 
*Very small. 

I would return during the day if I were in the area and if the Simpsons game was operative.
author: Spartevan V.

description: Centrally located and a nice selection of drink cocktails. Make sure to order some of the appetizers.
author: Austin R.

description:
I've been here twice. First before I moved to the bay. Second after I started a new job around the corner. 

I remember having a burger here my first time but ho-ly shit... this time I've realized the burgers here are bomb. Mushroom burger all the way. 

So flavorful. So juicy, but not messy. Burger perfection. My only regret is that I didn't order two.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Came with a bunch of my coworx on a Friday night. Margs were meh. It's a nice spot though, but doesn't seem like it'd be good for an intimate date (not sure why people are suggesting that). I like that it has space and games, though I didn't end up playing anything. 

Recommend for team hh.
author: Juliana P.

description:
The Willows has been extremely accommodating and patient with my weekly visits after work on Wednesdays.  Coinciding with their trivia nights, every week for the past month has been nothing but a pleasant getaway from the work week.

Enjoy a couple beers, listen to their jukebox and play billiards. You can also choose from their great selection of board games and old-school pinball machines!

If you're scouting for a quick bite, I recommend the sliders, fries and carne asada fries during happy hour!
author: Ryan K.

description:
So, the beans were absolutely SPECTACULAR! Bar food is just about all I live for so unlike most of their typical crowd I was there to enjoy the menu with a beer. The Willows staff was impeccable, polite and well engaged with new customers as well as what seemed to be their regulars. 
My boyfriend and I made a pit stop in SF on our way home from a vacation in Portland. We had never spent any real time in California and figured we could fit San Fran in and after this experience we are very glad we did. The kitchen staff even made their way out on the floor which I always love, everyone was polite and having a great time. 

Cold beer and quality food, I couldn't have asked for anything more! The only real bummer is that the women's restroom only has one toilet so the line can accumulate pretty quickly. But, that comes with any women's restroom...it's the price we pay for traveling in packs
author: Tessa F.

description:
Great beer selection and love the laid back atmosphere. I had the vegetarian sloppy joe with fries which I loved. Great meal for a great price.

Downside was the guy serving the beer was a bit of a jerk, smug when we ordered our beers and a bit of a dick when I returned our empty glasses.

I will be back and hopefully it will be with less attitude, been there done that, it actually isn't cool.
author: Greg R.

description:
Was at the nearby car dealership and was starving. I did a quick Yelp search for what was around and may have decent food and found The Willows. 

When I walked in I was a bit...shocked. It looked like a straight up dive bar. But don't let the clientele or trappings fool you; the food was fantastic. I ordered the Mary burger which comes with avocado and bacon. The burger had to be one of the best I have ever eaten. Seriously Ever. 

The bacon was thick as promised and tasted great. The avocado was fresh and they didn't skimp on it. I also ordered the Greek salad which was fresh and there was obvious attention and intent paid to the salad; it wasn't just a bunch of ingredients thrown haphazardly together. 

The bartender was very friendly and accommodating. Well worth a drop in for a pint of one of their great beers on tap and a meal. The death metal on the speakers was a bit much though. ;-)
author: Ex I.

description: I'm a regular happy hour attendee of this place. Awesome selection of beers on tap and for a fair price. Beers $1 off and $3 well drinks during HH. There are 2 bars. Good bar bites too. Try the pork belly donuts and mac n cheese balls! Fries, deviled eggs are fine. Some pinball machines and pool table around too. Super casual place. Aside from beers, they've got a full bar for well drinks and other things. The bloody mary, margarita, and mai tai are all solid. And guess what, they also make a scorpion bowl!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
(1) DIY Burger - got to pick two items, came in a delish beef patty, the bun.. omg.. carbs.. soooo good!!! 4 stars! Fries were fatten ... and great! 5 stars for the fries!

(2) Pull Pork Burger - Oh man, where do I start! SOOOOO AMAZING! 5 Stars!!! Addicted! 

(3) Service - homeboy was great! 

(4) Beer... lots of selection!!! Dog something snake IPA.. yums! 5 stars

**OVERALL - Must get Pull Pork Burger + IPA ... yeahhh! 4 stars overall!
author: Mindy Y.

description:
I had this place on my radar for awhile, and we finally made it here on a Friday night a few weeks ago.

The servers and bartenders are nice, although one bartender had no idea how to make some very basic drinks.

I like that they have different seating areas . Depending on the amount of people you're with, whether you're eating or not, the variety is pretty cool. If you're in a party mood or more a mellow chill mood, there's a seating area that suits it.

The hubby and I split a burger and pulled pork sandwich.
I liked both, and the fries were pretty awesome.

The burger was a little over what we requested, but not enough to send it back.

This seems like a fantastic neighborhood place. Good food, great beer selection as well as full bar, arcade games, a pool table, and they have pub trivia nights and beer events.

I SO wish it was in my neighborhood!
author: Amanda G.

description:
What's not to like about this place? They have arcade games, a pool table, little seating nooks, and taller bar tables, and 2 bar areas with a decent selection of $5-8 beers on tap. 

I had the jalapeno mac and cheese balls to accompany my beer and it was pretty good...although I think they could've put a little more jalapeno heat into the mix, but hey, that's just the asian in me talking.

Apparently they have a sister bar in the Mission called the Sycamore that I need to check out now, but I'm guessing it's the same, relaxed vibe and affordable drinks. I'll be back!
author: Sam L.

description: Horrible bar with horrible service. The bartender was rude when I ordered my 1st round. My 2nd round literally took 20 minutes to make  experience was so bad I literally download yelp on my phone just to write this review.
author: Maximillian F.

description:
Waited 17 minutes to get 2 drinks at 8pm on a Monday. There were 3 people in front of me.  17 minutes.  The bartender was probably the slowest service person I've ever come across. 

Their house bubbly is also Wycliffe. yech. 

I wanted to get food but after experiencing the wait for drinks, I decided I didn't want to die before getting my dinner.

Seems like a chill place, though I don't know why you'd make a special trip there. Seems like it caters to ppl who live close to it.
author: Alice Z.

description:
Friendly people, great food, good service, fun place to chill and relax,
Mushroom kingdom my fave burger, so filling and delicious,
Many beers to try
My go to cocktail whiskey Arnold Palmer
Clean bathrooms Very Important
Games to play
Try everything here the staff are very friendly and helpful 
Occasionally there are fun events like art shows and live djs 
Off the beaten track but worth it !
author: Mike M.

description:
So happy to see hooks under every seat at the bar and at the high tables!

Boasting a full bar and a tasty menu, the Willows is a great spot for a wide audience (some of whom may or may not be your cup of tea), whether you're killing time before a show at Slim's or DNA, or just hanging out. 

Order everything at either bar, take a number to your seat and they'll bring the food. If I'm ravenous I get the pulled pork sandwich; for a medium appetite, a couple of sliders will do (my top 3: lamb, fish, and fried chicken w/ tomatoes), or the chicken salad (the low-carb version of the sliders). 

Granted, I found out about this place from their (smaller, beer-only) sister bar, the Sycamore, but I don't think I can call myself too biased if I only got to know them from being a regular customer over the last couple years. Run by good people with good hearts (and good taste in music), and in my book that's pretty great.
author: Krista L.

description: I love coming to this bar. Bradford is a great bartender and is always on top of things. I am new to this city and this place makes me feel like I was back home. I always have a great time and love it when he is working. Keep up the good work Bradford. I will keep coming back every week!!!
author: Brandi R.

description:
-Pros-
Arcade games
Pool Table
Board Games
Split Rooms (one for beer/another for liquor)
Good amount of seating 
Decent drink specials
Low key, no where nearly as crowded as other places 

-Cons-
Weak drinks 
Lack of craft cocktails 

Overall Thoughts

Fun atmosphere with plenty of things to do but not sold on the drinks
author: Eddie W.

description:
Came here Wednesday night with some co-workers. Got a strange sense of deja-vu - like I've been here before back when it was another bar or restaurant.

In any case, this is definitely a strange place. Don't get me wrong - I had a decent time and all. It's just that this place doesn't really have an identity. It's kind of all over the map. On one hand, it's kind of a divey SOMA bar with a pool table. On the other hand, they sell food (burgers, sandwiches, pork belly donuts, etc.). They also have their own craft beer bar in the back, and a small video arcade in the front. This place is literally trying to be everything for everyone.

I ordered a Side Car to kick off my evening. It was tasty/strong - and made with their own special cognac. However, when I tried to order a second one, the bartender informed me that they they "ran out of the ingredients."  Um... ok. No biggie. I'll have an Old Fashioned then.

In any case, the food is actually decent pub grub. I ordered the fried chicken slider and the lamb slider. Warning: although delicious, the sliders are quite small (even for a slider). So I'd recommend ordering at least 3 or 4 if you're really hungry. The burger looked large and scrumptious. The fried mac and cheese balls with dipping sauce was a winner. And even though they sound weird, the pork belly donuts were actually pretty good.

Service here is definitely spotty. Don't expect a waiter to come to your table (even though they have a full menu). All food orders need to be placed at the bar. It took us about 20 minutes to figure that one out (but that's our own fault). The bartender (who seemed a bit overwhelmed) typed in our order, and we received our food within 20 minutes. 

FYI - they do trivia night on Wednesdays at 7pm. There's no cost to play. And the winning team gets $30. Though make sure the other teams aren't cheating. I'm convinced that the team behind us was using their smart phone to look up answers. Oh well.

All in all, this place is decent - not great. If I come back, it will def be for trivia night.
author: Kevin B.

description:
My wife and I strolled by this joint a few months back and I bookmarked it for future inspection.  Inspection day was today, and we arrived with a balanced thirst and appetite.

Upon walking in on a lazy Sunday afternoon, the Willows looked like a bar or lounge in the pre-amp hours, lots of dark wood and black leather booths, but with rock music wonderfully blasting on the sound system.  We were greeted amiably by the bartenders, sat down and browsed the cocktail and menus.  Peering up, we saw the selection of board games and local denizens playing pool and pinball in the periphery.  Solid.

Onto the food/drink: they have an indulgent selection of gastropub menu items and some interesting cocktail offerings, too. We ordered the fried mac 'n' cheese bites, the Western burger and the Black Bean Patty burger.  I'd pass on the mac 'n' cheese bites, they were somewhere in the realm of meh, just tasted liked a breaded version of the Kraft variety.  Both burgers were quite good, not epic but solid in taste and freshness.  

The cocktails were so-so; I had the margarita and it was a bit too sweet and syrupy, not enough kick.  The followup, the Lo Siento, with grapefruit juice + tequila was better but nothing to write home about either. 

So if the food and drink was just slightly above average overall, why the 4 stars you ask?  The bartenders, that's why.  They were super-friendly and provided great service, even with the chill vibe on a Sunday afternoon.  

For Missionites, this place is kinda like a spacious Sycamore, both in food quality and atmosphere, and better in service and attitude.  Worth checking out for sure.
author: Saminda W.

description:
Any bar that has a big stash of board games and cards against humanity for me to play, is a winner in my book. 
Came here with a big group for a birthday and it was a fun spot. Good burgers and fries (veggie and regular) and reasonable drinks. They will make you bounce to different bars (there's 2) to order certain drinks though, which always kind of annoys me. 
Bonus - Cuddly, woodsy, dark booths in the front for date night.
author: Kristina K.

description:
....This place screams 1800s hipster steam punk. 

I ordered a signature drink, which... the bartender didn't know how to make, served with a side of sass (thanks but... you wanna be sassy? gGo to Zeitgeist and give me all the sass you want - at least there I'll get my drink made properly.) 

Crowd seemed older, prices were eh, and there are just so many better bars to go to... not a fan.
author: Emily D.

description: strange little place for sure. The outer bar is 4 feet from the inner bar area and if you want a real drink you have to walk in there yourself.... od! The food is just bar food, done well but nothing special in my opinion. The service was average friendly. Not a place that for me will get a repeat performance.
author: Brook M.

description:
Went here on a Friday night.  Good vibe -- fun, but not too crowded.  Good place for friends to hang out.  The bartender was very friendly and recommended a good beer (Ommegang Witte) based on my liking Hoegaarden -- well priced!  $6!

The music can be a bit loud if you're looking to chat / catch up with friends, but generally quite a convivial space! Great place to grab a drink and hang out with friends!
author: Kathryn C.

description:
It's called "the willows" but it should be called "the aioli" since that's pretty much what's going on here.  Came here with a friend and we had:
- Pork belly donuts (which are just battered and fried bacon chunks served in syrup) which, to be fair, didn't have aioli.
- The fries with a "threesome of aioli" or something - two of which were awesome and one of which was too mayoey.  This dish was probably my fav.
- The sliders, which were all good and had aioli on them.
- Mac and cheese balls, which were a little bland (full disclosure: I make the best mac n cheese everrr, with truffle oil and sriracha) served with a big thing of, you guessed it, aioli!

Fortunately, I didn't kiss anyone that night.

I would come back for sure, since their menu had tons of other exciting-sounding things and sh*t tons of bottled beers - which, reader please note, differ depending on whether you are in the small bar (tons) or big bar (few).
author: Aaron M.

description: Friendly bartenders. Buck shot. Decent spot, but the food seems a little overpriced. Paid $12 for basically an in-n-out cheeseburger.
author: Ryan H.

description: Chill place to hangout. They have a pool table and pinball machine. $10 happy hour beer and shot combo!
author: Erville V.

description: My wife's birthday, the Willows was great! We chilled, ate, drank and played board games. We brought SET and half of us played a new Zombie game. They even brought out a cake for us!!
author: Morgan J.

description:
Great beer selection, Decent prices and The Best burgers in town. That isn't hyperbole, I'm very picky about burgers and these are better than the over priced and over hyped burger at Zuni.

If you are a beer lover they have quality craft brews on rotating taps at some of the best prices in town.

The atmosphere is warm and friendly, it's a very comfortable place to be.
author: Manny F.

description: Very loud, seating far from comfy but many patrons seem to love meeting here after work. But if you want to have a conversation, not so much. Not for me but again saw happy patrons.
author: F P.

description:
I had the DIY Burger w/fries for lunch.  The meat was good, but I felt the specialty garnishes should have been better.  

The restaurant is like a bar/pool hall setting.
author: Mei B.

description:
Last Saturday at about 10:30pm I witnessed one of the bouncers throw a glass object at a tree on the sidewalk where it shattered. Welcome to the neighborhood! 

Suggestion: tell your people working the door to have some respect for the surrounding areas.
author: Shalana M.

description: came here last night with a gf to catch up on things and to observe the art on walls! im glad i tried this spot because it's not typically something i would have picked - a bit divey, interesting art, lots of beers on tap and pub food. meeps! we chilled at a high top by the large windows on one side.  there are actually two bars here- which is interesting.  and the cool thing is that you can transfer your tab between the two bars - no need to open 2 tabs or get your credit card! i wasnt impressed at all by my mezcal/ muddle jalapeno cocktail, but enjoyed the stout beers. i probably wont be coming back because it's a bit far away for me...and the ambiance is something that im not used to...
author: Christina L.

description:
I don't very frequently write reviews, but I felt like I had an obligation to write this one. Since moving from Boston, the one thing I miss food-wise is a Boston style roast beef sandwich. The Willows has the closest thing I have had to that sandwich outside of Boston. The sandwich has a lightly toasted bun, thinly sliced roast beef, BBQ sauce and mayo. I added pickles just because I think it makes the sandwich. Was it perfect? No - I think the roast beef probably could have been a little less well-done. But, that being said, it was an awesome sandwich. I would come back just for that. 

I've had the burger (it was also delicious) and the pork belly donuts (pretty good), and they always have good beer on tap and board games if you're into that kind of thing. Overall, a pretty awesome bar.
author: Brigitte J.

description: Comfort food at its core.The mimosas are to die for and also has a tremendous beer selection. Cant wait to come back for more than just 5 seconds!
author: Brandon A.

description: What happened to this place?  They used to have some of the best burgers in SF.  I used to live in the neighborhood and ate here regularly.  After not visiting for about 6 months, I had a craving and came here for lunch.  My Western Burger came out well-done when I ordered medium, and the bun was so stale that it was tough and difficult to chew through.  The only discernible flavor in the salad dressing was black pepper.  The salads used to come with little bits of heirloom tomatoes, but apparently no longer.  Yet this still cost over $16.  They've dramatically reduced the quality without lowering the prices.  I will not be coming back any time soon.
author: Miles B.

description: I absolutely love coming here on a Sunday--best brunch and mimosas in town! We watched the game, played some of their handy board games, drank mimis and noshed on a killer brunch. It's hard to find the trifecta of excellent service, full bar and amazing food for brunch in SF where you don't have to wait for hours in line and this spot delivers. The bartender Cam is on point!
author: Pvn V.

description: Great little place. Carne Asada fries were amazing! Josh was attentive and engaging. Beer bar had a great sour.
author: Laura K.

description: After hearing so much about the cool beer selection and games here i decided to check it out. Points for having the weirdest board games. The red neck game? beeropoly? Fun :P They were out of bloody mary's and it was maybe an hour or two into brunch. That was disappointing. I had the craft cocktail version of it which was horrendous. tasted like watered down v8. it was awful. there was some company offering beer samples to calculate your drink preference, which they kept encourage but once you talk to them, they want $20! for what?! i can taste my own beer and figure out what i like, thanks. Bartender was friendly enough. The beer selection was average. not my favorite dive. average.
author: Zara S.

description:
Yeah, beer week, whatever... Good beer.
But you know, after the fourth beer you are hungry.
And, you order a burger. 
I got the second one on the list, qnd, incredibly good. A SOLID burger.
Fries are very good.

Hell yes. You guys rock
author: Alessandro M.

description: All the things you want in a local pub! Great nibbles, kick-ass burgers with some "interesting" enhancement options, a well-curated selection of craft ales, and staff who knows what they're doing. And... the donuts! YUM! Great for post work conversation. Maybe there's a game on, but it's not the focus of the whole room, which I appreciate.
author: J. D.

description:
Every time I visit the Willows I love it more.

Two bars, with two different/relaxing rooms.  I actually prefer to sit on the craft beer side because it typically seems less crowded, plus I like the little cubby hole booths.  

Service has always been stellar.  Everyone there obviously loves their job.

Great selection of food, whether you're ordering small bites or a full meal everything is pretty yummy.  I haven't tried brunch yet, but I'm very excited about it.

Over all this place is great! I wish it was a little closer to my house!
author: Margaret I.

description: I've come here for dinner before and it was really tastey and great beer selection but I was not expecting much for brunch. So wrong. First off, free coffee which was self serve and my hangover adored. Second, the pork belly donuts aka little bites of heaven are amazing. I ordered the corned beef hash and it was awesome. Not your usual canned with an egg dumped on top, but actual corned beef and potatoes. I got a biscuit to go with and it was one of the best I've had on the city. Big and flaky and buttery. Food wise everything was great. I got a spiked Thai iced tea and then decided this place is a total unicorn. It wasn't a get-wasted-at-brunch kind of day so I skipped on the bottomless mimosas but they are only 12.50!! Next time I come I'll bringing my drinking shoes. Overall I dig this place over the Sycamore, bigger, better and friendly. Staff were really great too. I really can't say a bad word. I was amazed it was empty at noon on a Saturday too!! And the music selection spoke to my angsty teen heart. Literally all the things!
author: C K.

description: The place that does everything. A really great place to have at your disposable. They have a craft beer bar, they have cocktails, pool, pinball, board games, large tables for socializing, small intimate booths for private conversations, they're open all the time. Now that I'm writing this I'm bumping it up to 4 stars. I think the food is 2 stars and the cocktails are just okay but this place is doing a public service. They should get government funding for what they do for the community.
author: Geoff G.

description: Kickass bartenders and chill atmosphere. Pool table and good grub. Happy hours have been fun.
author: tomohisa w.

description: Total dive bar with incredible bar food. They do that grilled-cheese-sandwiches-as-hamburger-buns-for-your-cheeseburger thing and it is every bit as decadent and delicious as it sounds. Their sliders are also really tasty. I got their cobb salad once and it was actually really good. Their mixed drinks are not the strongest so I suggest going for beer instead.
author: Amy Y.

description: Tell your male bartender that works on Saturday evenings (more specifically last night 9/17) that there's no reason to yell obscenities and "buck up" to a woman that is 5'2" about having a fake ID because he doesn't know what an out of state Drivers License looks like. I'm 24 years old and never in my life have experienced such a violent trigger and disrespect in a San Francisco bar before. I had two IDs readily available for the skeptical and your bartender wanted to make his night more difficult and refused to see my second form of ID. Not to mention he also followed me out of his liquor bar into the beer bar where I was going to retrieve my belongings and let my friends know what was going on. Your bartender was less than a foot away from me, yelling at me, telling me he didn't give a fuck about me getting my belongings, and that I needed to get the fuck out because after being accused of having a fake ID, I didn't want a drink from him. Not to mention the person working the front bar had ALREADY checked my ID and it was fine. I will NEVER come here again because he made me feel completely unsafe and I don't know what would've happened if my friends weren't there. Your bartender needs to get his shit together or lay down his machismo vibe because nobody deserves this shit.
author: Kris A.

description:
Worst service I've ever had. You have to do everything through the bartender. So you have to compete for his attention and wait while he does shots. He charged me and gave me a number, but never put the order in. After waiting half an hour I asked the bartender about our food. That's when he finally put our order in. 

Once it arrived the aioli was missing. I told the guy who brought our food and he said that he didn't know. I showed him the menu which says it comes with aioli. He said he didn't know and walked away. Had to talk to  bartender again. He did bring the aioli quickly after that. 

Also, they were out of wings.
author: Chris R.

description: The rotating beer tap is the best I've ever seen... they only have ~10 beers on tap every night, but they get some very exotic and delicious brews (I've tried a spicey jalapeno ale, an interesting lemon concoction, and a hoppy apple cider, among many others) and they rotate out frequently. I don't think I've ever seen the same beer 2 weeks in a row. Food portions are small but pretty tasty, I don't think I'd ever eat there for a meal but what else do you expect from a bar? Bartenders are friendly and helpful.
author: Derek R.

description: I came in really excited cause I love this bar. I love their wings and pulled pork sandwich. However if it gets busy and I have to wait more than 10 minutes for a drink I have to say service sucks. Hire another bartender at busy hours or even someone that works the cashier geez. Slow service ... !
author: Jennie C.

description:
We LOVE The Willows.  It is a great beer bar, dive bar, neighborhood bar.  It is anything but pretentious and achieves everything it aims to be.

With that said, let's be clear:  The Willows sits in the western end of SoMa.  It is a bar where you can hang out, play pool, play cards, eat great bar food, drink exquisite beer.  It is NOT a pick-up joint.  It is NOT a place to come and flaunt your latest app.  It is NOT a place to flaunt yourself or your wares.

LOVE this bar because the staff is relaxed, yet completely dedicated.  There is a craft beer side of the bar with about 12-14 taps and some nice bottles (for in-bar consumption).  Excellent tap choices, usually focused on West Coast offerings, but their ability to obtain unusual beers from the East Coast (especially Maine) is impressive.  Obviously, one of the owners has a special "in" with several local breweries because this bar occasionally taps a keg that is only available at Willows, or at its sister bar, The Sycamore.  They also have macrobrews in bottles for those who drink bad beer (blech ... Why those folks even bother to wake up in the morning, I'll never know).  

The pub menu is perfect for those who have no guilt about what they will eat while imbibing.  On a diet? This isn't the bar menu for you.  Are you a hedonist?  You have hit the jackpot, buddy, because they grill their sandwich bread in BUTTER before slapping on the meat.  The OMFC is a hamburger served inside two grilled cheese sandwiches.  Jackpot.  Seriously.

I haven't spent much time at the non-craft beer side, but I do see they have a full bar and lots of drink specials.  That room is much larger, with tables, gaming areas, pool tables and a large standing 'share' table.

Let's also be joyous of the fact that this was one of the first bars in SF to ban Google glasses.  Keep the glassholes away!  Thank you, Willows!  

I highly recommend this bar to folks who live in SoMa and the Mission.  It's very reminiscent of the way SF used to be.  And I love that.
author: Joe W.

description:
Please reprimand the ginger waitress. She is nothing but rude and bitter about working at your bar. Very rude and unhelpful 

In addition, please work on consistency. Every time I have visited, the portions differ. It's very disappointing.

Love the carnitas fries, but will not be returning due to the terrible service and poor portion consistency.
author: Ross S.

description: Killer veggie burger, strong drinks, and retro pinball machines, what's not to love?
author: Matt V.

description:
This is the bar it wants to be. Unpretentious, fun/casual bar food, decent beer selection, a refreshing departure from industrial, concrete-slabbed, Kinfolk-like settings serving IPAs in Mason jars. As much as I like that kind of thing, sometimes you have to mix it up! 

There is also a pool table and cool people and $1 off draft happy hour before 7pm. Free wifi.
author: Marybeth B.

description: My favorite lunch time spot to relax and get away from the office BS for my lunch time. The bartenders are super cool and really make you feel at home. The food is a total upscale to bar food although I wish they still had all the sliders they use to!!! Me and most of my coworkers frequent this place regularly. I wish I knew the name of the female bartender whom is my favorite. Its always so hard to go back to work!!!
author: Sherry T.

description: Jen and Jenna are the business! Had a great brunch with these girls looking after us. Such a good brunch experience, definitely be back!
author: Aileen D.

description:
These people do things with pork belly - lots of things.  They tell you to share the doughnut. Yes, there is a pork belly doughnut.
