If I were a single dude, I would get a couple of orders and walk around asking people if they wanted to try some. It is certainly a conversation starter and tasty - fortunately.
 
I'm more of a tea-toatler but I noticed both bottomless mimosas and bloody marys. I usually have only noticed the former.  There is a do-it-yourself bloody mary bar!  It seems to delight adults.
 
What is delightful for kids of all ages is that, in addition to 2 pool tables, there are boardgames. There are dozens of them. The seating is such that you could enjoy a game during your meal.
 
The menu is creative and solidly delicious. Service is nifty, I suggest visiting.
author: Joanna B.

description:
Everything is super rad!!
Great beer selection and the food is hella good!!
I will definitely be back!!
author: Aaron M.

description: The food was good, but I left rather unhappy with the staff. A bit of background, it was my first time visiting the establishment and I had asked staff about the size of the sliders. The staff member gave me a good idea of how big these burgers were and I decided to order. I went immediately to the restroom, and when I came back I was given a moderately sized burger. In other restaurants I've been to the size of the sliders are rather large (buffalo burgers). I was a bit confused by how big it was, but just started eating anyway. Staff stopped by to let me know that I had eaten the wrong burger, I apologized and paid for it. I did not appreciate that one staff member, began commenting about me negatively to her customers, at one point saying that "I stole the burger." I found it offensive and was embarrassed by the situation. It infuriated me, that even after I tried to make amends for the mix-up, I was treated like a petty thug. I am not here to troll, but I just couldn't let this one go. The establishment is fine otherwise, and wouldn't discourage people from coming.
author: Edward R.

description: Great burger! Stopped in here for food when we got into town. Quick service from a helpful bartender. I would totally come back if I lived around here. The only thing that would make it better would be more beers on tap.
author: Kyle M.

description:
Since I did not plan ahead, me and my boyfriend decided to go to the Willows for the New Year's celebration instead of going to a club. 

I bought the New Year's tickets online, the day of, and had no problem getting in. 

We got beef sliders with fries and I thought both were divine! However, the bartender did not have any mint, so no mojitos for me :( Also, since it was pretty busy the service was slow. 

The New Year's deal included sliders, campaign toast at midnight, as well as other drink specials. The fruit punch was one of the specials, but it was just ok, not much alcohol there :P 

I guess my biggest frustration was the music - some weird indie stuff. The dj seemed to be the only one digging her own music :P I was hoping for something to dance to, but it was simply impossible. No one else was dancing either... 

Anyway, I would like to come back there on a regular day :)

PS. I loved party hats and glasses provided by the venue
author: Elena M.

description:
We went for the 1st time there on a Sunday evening . We ordered the Cobb salad and a Beet beat salad. The Cobb salad came without bacon at all, the quality of the ingredients also horrible and it had no taste . Then, in my beet salad I found on my fish some hair and the salad was so bad tasting... Ugh I'm definitely not gonna come here again ..
The bartender was pretty nice and he gave us the money back on one salad at least ...
author: Andreea G.

description:
This is the sister bar to the sycamore out in the mission so it has that same great decor and feel to it. Seems like they have more room here. 

I love the pork belly donuts and so a couple of my friends and I stopped in for a beer and the donuts specifically. The beer selection is similar to the sycamore so you can't go wrong with that. The pork belly donuts with that makers mark maple glaze is divine! 

This is a great place to grab a couple of beers and hang out/ catch up with some buddies.

They have a separate section which has a poll table and a couple of pinball games so there's lots to keep u entertained!

One thing was that the women's bathroom was out of order when I was there. They put caution tape all around the door and had a note that said hell inside do not open or anything. Hopefully they've fixed this? The guys bathroom was pretty clean though :)
author: Christine W.

description: Came here for brunch. Great atmosphere, looking forward to returning for a beer later.
author: Beer W.

description:
My last meal there was the OMFC burger, which actually blew my mind it was so yummy. I ordered it in part for the ridiculous factor, and then promptly devoured it.

I am also a fan of the FU Grandpa cocktail, and the just-announced ban on Google recording devices.  Thank you for that.

And to anyone who choses to be offended by Cards Against Humanity, I say that you are missing the point & need to consider that it is the very transgression that makes it such an entertaining and fun game to play.
author: Liz R.

description:
Craft Beers and Cocktails. Board games. Pinball. Put those all together and you've got a recipe for an awesome hangout spot at the Willows!

Stepping into the Willows you are greeted almost immediately with a sign listing all their craft beers in their first room. Craft brews from as far reaches as Portland, Maine or as closely hidden as Santa Rosa they have great tasting brews from near and far reaches of the country! My personal favorite is the Allagash Curieux- this bourbon barrel aged ale seems to fit so well with the decor- it just works!

The second room is what my friends and I call the fun and games room! Why? Because the room is set up for as stated earlier- fun and games! There are huge tables with ample seats where those who come in for a drink can also grab some of their favorite board games to test their skills with their friends! To top it all off there's a bar in this room just 10 feet from the board games! So you can hang out and share a tasty drink in the front room or you can take it to the second room and test your wit and creativity with Cards against Humanity (my personal favorite game because I do better when I get more drinks from the bar in me; win -win!). 

Lastly, what could make a night better than some good beer, cocktails, and board games? The delicious food! A must have any time I visit is their infamous Pork Belly "Donuts"/beignets- warm dough and pork never tasted so good while glazed over with maple bourbon syrup! Other favorites include their fried mac and cheese balls and the simple yet savory salt and pepper fries. 

Before you finish the night off, remember to check out their pinball room since next to the board game room. I'm not sure why, but every time I go, I am compelled to play a round or two... when was the last time most of us can remember play pinball? Exactly. 

The Willows is definitely a great place to unwind and hangout with your friends over some nice drinks and board game competition-friendly of course! Loser buys the next round!
author: Jon K.

description:
I came here with a friend for a late lunch/ early dinner. I ordered a burger and a Sweet tea drink. The burger was similar to regular bar food and the drink was mediocre. The bartender was very chill and seemed like he could only handle one order at a time (we had to order the drink and food separately each time.

This bar is somewhat divey and chill. They offer a few board games, arcade games and pool if people are interested in them. There's lots of space and 3 rooms/areas for people to hang. 

I wasn't particularly impressed by their food or their drinks, hence the 3 stars. However, I really like the relaxed atmosphere and would come here again to play board games with friends.
author: Lillian C.

description: Amazing beers, awesome burgers, really cool atmosphere. Didn't expect to find this in SOMA.
author: John D.

description:
Great place to chill with friends and play some board games (they have an interesting selection) and grab some Crabbies alcoholic ginger beer. 
There is a pool table and pinball machines. 
The burgers are up to par, the slider are big enough to feed someone with a small appetite. Loved the Mac and cheese fried balls.
author: Veneta N.

description:
Awesome new addition to the area! Food and service was great; looking forward to trying more.

Edit: this place is by my work so I've come back multiple times. Each experience with the service has been worse than the last. Staff love to bicker and food loves to never make it to the table. I'm writing this review while waiting half an hour for a burger. Done. Sorry guys.
author: Tim S.

description:
This place definitely has potential, although I didn't really get to fully experience it because I wasn't feeling so well when we went. 

Here are my thoughts though: 

Positives +:
+ Two bars, one with craft beers and another with hard alcohols. They also have daily specials with different drinks each day, and a great happy hour for both food and drinks. 
+ Games! Lots of board games all over the place for you to lounge and hang out with friends
+Dog friendly(?) - I don't know for sure, but there was a dog sitting on a bar stool when we went. So, that's cool. 
+Fried mac'n'cheese balls - they were pretty good
+Pork belly donut - pretty unique, although it was a bit too greasy for my liking. Very rich in flavor though! 

This place is pretty cool, I'd definitely go back for a night of drinking with friends.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I was excited for a new place to open up since I work so close. 
But the experience was horrible. 

The food was ok to say the lease. The service is horrible. 

I don't think I'd come back. Unfortunate cause its a block away
author: John Louie B.

description:
Meh. Came here for a late night meal but felt I could've gotten better quality food for the price. 

I saw mac n cheese balls on the menu and my expectations far exceeded the outcome. Very little flavor and not much cheese. I thought the sloppy joe was pretty tasty although the sandwich could've used cheese. Also, I tried some of our friends' carne asada fries and... just no. Perhaps they're known for some items we didn't order but I wasn't very satisfied with what we got. 

I did like the ambience of the first room but the connected larger room with a pool table felt much more grungy. May return but probably not for food.
author: Jamie B.

description: The strictly work burger was very good. The beet salad was ok, just wish the beets were fresher. Great selection of sour beers here. I really liked the Monk cafe Flemish sour ale, however they're all bottled. Wish they had more draft craft beers. Place has more of a divey feel. There's a pool table and a bunch of old school games like pin ball. Good place if you just want to meet with friends for beers.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Great place to hangout with friends.  The beer selection is amazing, and apparently they switch out the beers one by one when the keg is done, so there will always be another beer to try.  
There are two bars and two rooms.  The bathroom was clean.  Parking was not a problem.
Trista was a fabulous hostess and treated us like royalty.  I like the game tournaments,  art shows, Oktoberfest, board games, and FOOD.
The crowd was friendly.   I was the oldest person there,  but I didn't feel out of place.  Check it out, you'll be pleasantly surprised.
author: Laura B.

description:
Living near by, I've been waiting for something to open up in this space where The Mercury Lounge formerly inhabited. It was about 3 weeks ago when the bf and I walked by and noticed there were some renovations going on - arcade additions, new tables, etc. The other night after leaving Izakaya House we decided to stop by.

Immediately walking in, I noticed the bartender from The Sycamore and mentioned it to my bf. There is a larger area along 12th Street, but the entrance is on Folsom, FYI, with a smaller seating area. We walked through to the main room and sat down at the bar. We ended up speaking to Liz and while I was taking a phone call, I came back to find out that Liz and her brother also own The Sycamore - duh! 

Glad to see another local spot open up that has food and liquor. Hope they do well - please get your hours up on Yelp!
author: Johanna L.

description: Digging the burgers here. Looks like a non-descript bar outside, but inside, it's a large space that has food and a good selection of beers...crafts on one side, regular bottles (not that many draughts) on the other. Juicy Floozy burger was tasty, but the burger had too much sauce on it, causing my bottom bun to deteriorate rather fast, and I was eating it open faced after a few bites. Working Stiff was a little easier to eat, and I'm always a fan of burgers with jalapenos on it. To save money (beers are a tad pricey, even for bottles), I went with a High Life with my food. On the other side, went Belgian, which I always enjoy. The bartenders are extremely nice and accommodating, which always rocks. Just bring some extra money, this isn't your run-of-the-mill dive bar. Also bring quarters for pinball in the back.
author: Dan M.

description:
Great all around venue 
Brunch, Drinks, Lunch, Dinner, video games, pin ball, and much, much more. I blew five hours in here like it was nothing.

Count me in every time I'm invited (oh, and happen to be in SF.)
author: William C.

description: I stayed around the corner from here and it was my first stop in SF. It's welcoming vibe lured me right in. We had a couple great beers. A Sour beer and a farmhouse brew. Both tasty. We also grabbed an order of the Mac n cheese balls. Very good! If this place was in my neighborhood in LA I would be there often!
author: Megan M.

description:
Gave the pork belly donuts a try and they were pretty great. I loved the added sea salt on top.  It complimented to maple syrup perfectly.  I also tried the veggie pitta pizza and the fried mac and cheese balls. The pizza had tried tomatoes, artichoke hearts and a killer balsamic vinegarette. The mac and cheese balls were typical not the worst not the best.
The Willows is a pretty cool dive bar. Main bar area has some classic arcade games and pool table. Music was playing and the majority of people were in this room. There's also a back room, which on this particular day was the quite room. Less crowded and the music wasn't blasting back there. Had some nice private booths built into the walls. 

I'd totally come back here just for some of their food.
author: Dominic P.

description: Worst bar ever. The bartender not only refused me service because we didn't leave a hefty tip but he told me and my friend to get the fuck out. We were not disruptive or anything of the sort. We bought at least 4 drinks a piece and ordered food the previous time we went to the bar. I wouldn't recommend this bar unless you want to spend  $20 tip per item. the bartender was discriminatory because me and my friend "didn't fit the mold " of their normal clientele
author: Austin C.

description:
had to clean our own table....had to go order food at the bar.....had to pay for food when we ordered it......had to ask for utensils, then the male bartender coped an attitude, went to the other bar for forks....GEEZ.  Great Bloody Mary, great burger...I would love to make this a regular hang out since I live a few blocks away, but the lack of service and just plain simple attention will keep me away.  You have everything you need to be successful here, but the attitude SUCKS
Simply the new SF business model, get as much of their money as you can without doing anything for it.  BTW, customers DO NOT like to be abused
SAD....I really want to support my neighborhood businesses, but Willows doesnt want us!
author: Mark S.

description:
Got to say, the concept works. Turning an old building into a comfy bar, with games, food, cubbies, friendly bartenders, well-made drinks, rare beers, a serious kitchen with mostly meat and hamburgers but some salads. I mean, people are taking things to new levels these days. The lighting is nice, the flooring, decoration. I feel like the old guy who had to tell the kids he walked five miles to go to school. Back in my day, you were lucky if they cracked open a Rolling Rock -- though that used to cost about seventy five cents. Today, just around the corner there is a bar with sincere (crazy, alternative lifestyle) people who will cater to your five senses and then some.

Anyway, if you are looking to adopt a bar like some people adopt a puppy, this could be your go-to place.
author: Gil S.

description:
I was on a walk on a break from work and I  wanted to find a nice beer. Apparently it was beer week so I had found the perfect bar... the guy at the front seemed nice, and the bar tender seemed nice at first, but as it turned they were already out of a bunch of beers, which didn't actually bother me. 

I realize the bar was busy, but even though I was pleasant, I started to get attitude from the bartender after sampling just one beer. I think he purposely poured my beer to have over an inch of thick head so I wouldn't be able to actually drink it any time soon, and I had work to get back to. The cup even had the 12oz line on it and the beer line swam far below it. How the hell is any bitch supposed to drink that without a cappuccino spoon?!

Instead of being passive aggressive and regretting it later, I went up to the bar and took back my dollar tip, let him know so I didn't look like I was taking his money, and he took my beer and dumped it down the sink and gave me my money back without any communication but a lame cop out, "what, you don't like head? That's what it's about." F*** that. I am not stupid.
author: Quintessa L.

description: Very casual, hole-in-the-wall atmosphere with surprisingly delicious bar food. The pork donuts are to die for and the mac & cheese balls are pretty fabulous.
author: Fallon M.

description:
Awesome. great place. reminds me of the old Hamburger Marys and not the three or 4 other places its been since. Great craft beer at the back bar. 
Food is pretty dam good pub grub, they have a great salad and all the sliders were awesome so far. Lunch is a bit confusing. you order at the bar and need to go up there when ya want more stuff, not that im lazy, im totally cool with it just thought i would throw it out there as an FYI. first few times i kinds sat waiting when that aint the gig.
All the staff is super cool as well. So stoked they moved into the hood.
author: Dennis K.

description: This place had a dogfish head takeover and served 120m IPA for hours... There is nothing else to say - this place rocks. I love The Willows.
author: Paul M.

description: Came here looking for a burger & a Bloody Mary; look no further. This place had great food and a cool atmosphere. The burger with fries was cooked perfectly. My girlfriend had the biscuits & gravy that were the bomb. The Bloody Mary was well balanced, not overly spiked. They have these pulled pork beignets covered in maple sauce. You'll have to try them cause I found them unique. All in all a good place for a Sunday brunch/lunch.
author: Victor G.

description: The Willows, yes, I am down. Man, the bartender over at the beer end of the bar is snotty as heck, but everyone else is super cool. The beer selection also isn't the best, but drinks are pretty cheap for the SOMA district, and they have loads of board games, pinball machines, and pool tables. The food is pretty bomb, too, and unlike other places in the area, this space is huge, so you can definitely find a spot to sit and hang out and meet random people. Bathroom situation is a little funky, but everything else is great.
author: Danny C.

description:
This place is awesome! I came on a Saturday night around 6 with a couple of friends and grabbed a free table.

They have great drink specials every day. Saturday was sweet tea vodka, which basically tasted like iced tea and no alcohol, and comes in a mason jar. Soo good.

To eat:
Pork Belly Donuts - not really a donut, but deep fried pork belly in batter with sweet flavoring. Incredibly good.
I also got the fried chicken and fried catfish slider. I think I just like fried things. Both were served quickly and were really juicy and full of flavor.

What makes this bar awesome is the board games that they have in the place. We played Cards Against Humanity, as well as Jenga with crazy commands on them, like go dry hump the jukebox.

The crowd here is pretty hip and very chill. They cheered on my drunk friends dry humping the jukebox and doing crazy dances.

The bathroom is sadly just 1 single men's and 1 single women's, so the lines can get long sometimes.
author: Michael W.

description:
Nice joint. Decently priced. Attentive staff. All the things that make a bar great can be found at The Willows, the sister of The Mission neighborhood's The Sycamore. A few things I like about this place:

- The Beer Bar: You can find some great brews here, including the super exclusive Speakeasy XXX Triple IPA. With a 12.5% ABV, don't drink this guy on an empty stomach

- Space! The venue is very spacey and the huge windows in the main area are a great touch as well. Note this place also has board games, pinball machines and a pool table. There are some really cute intimate booths to the side which I love sitting at

- Food: Great food. Pork Belly Donuts are LEGIT. Truth.
author: Trav M.

description: Great beer selection in the beer room/side and good cocktails in the bar side!  Been here twice now and on both visits the food was great!  Love the salt and pepper French fries, the pork belly donuts, the burger and the DRINKS!  Had the "Fuck You, Grandpa" as it seemed most appropriate as my younger buddies have made that my nickname.  They have three pinball machines and a pool table as well as a jukebox.  Good times!!  Special thanks to bartender Show-wa (misspelled for sure!)!!
author: Sean M.

description:
Willows is a chill spot. The night we went there were only a handful of people. It's a relaxing environment and pretty laid back. A couple of friends and I just played the board games and had a couple of drinks. 

I would recommend this place.
author: Arlo T.

description: Wow, what a disappointment. I called this place to confirm they had a hard to find beer (bcbs coffee) that my GF and I wanted. They confirmed they did so I hopped in an uber to head over immediately. When I arrived they showed it to me (and another beer called bcbs rare which they were charging a ridiculous $128 for) and told me they just had to find out how much it was. Since it was taking awhile, we decided to sit down and have brunch. After two hours of waiting patiently and finishing our meal plus two rounds of drinks, we were almost ready to leave and still were not able to buy the beer. The bartender told us they couldn't sell it to us since they couldn't get a price and that our only option would be to come back another day despite them selling it for the past couple days. Very frustrating. Then, as we were leaving, we heard them making jokes about how they would sell it to us for $1000 as if baiting us to come in and then wasting our time is funny. If this place was awesome I would not have made this review and chalked it up to a fluke bad experience. However, this place is mediocre at best and completely forgettable. I will never give them my business again nor will I advise anyone else to do so. Hopefully they can learn a thing or two about customer service so other patrons don't have to deal with their unprofessional business practices.
author: Andrew G.

description: Last night the heavy-set woman bartender was too busy doing shots with a guy who appeared to be an off-duty co-worker to take a food order from me and my mom, who is confined to a wheelchair. I finally had to go into the other room and order from the other bartender. In the 30 minutes we were there, I saw her down four shots. Unbelievable.
author: Johnny C.

description: Amazing beer selection. A lot of great craft beers. The burger was ok. It was very big, had lots of great toppings, but there was just something missing with the flavor of the meat. However, I really enjoyed the atmosphere and beer selection so I will definitely be going back.
author: Nick F.

description:
I am so so so excited that The Willows is finally open!  

As a long-time Sycamore fan, the temptation of a new bar by Liz, Trista, and Tym was too great to resist. I had my birthday party there and it was the perfect place for it: tons of space, amazing staff, delicious food, games for days, and all my guests were raving about how much they loved the bar. 

Dark burnt wood walls flicker with candlelight, beautiful nooks tuck you away for more private conversations, a gorgeous craft beer bar with wrought iron details... PLUS a pool table, Buckhunter, pinball, board games AND Cards Against Humanity?? Not to mention the food (fried chicken! sloppy joes!) and specialty drinks (the Tish!)... I daresay, I think I've found my next local bar. 

See you there.
author: Erin L.

description:
Just been here once, but so far I dig this place.  I went because I heard they have pinball and they have three machines here: Monster Bash, South Park and Road Show.  They also have some decent beers on tap like Almanac Farmers Reserve #3 (yum) and Drake's Blue Bottle Imperial Stout. 

Definitely wanna come back and try more here.  Go play some pinball and have a beer!
author: Gene X.

description: So just updated because I guess I was wrong that they are cash only..have had several messages that they take card... for some reason got the impression when I went they were cash only. But guess not!
author: Megan S.

description:
This bar is so new that they don't even have a sign yet -- it took me a couple minutes to find the door to get in!

That said, it seems like an excellent bar! There are two rooms -- the front room has a bar with a great selection of beers on tap, and the back room has a full bar with delicious cocktails.

The bar is nice and spacious, good for groups. They even have a pool table, which all too few bars in the city do.

I didn't get a chance to try the food, but it looked tasty.
author: Joe S.

description:
Pork belly donuts. I don't even want to write this review because then the secret will be out and I may not be able to get my paws on those crispy, bourbon and maple infused pork belly balls. 
There's board games too.
author: Lauren D.

description: Pork belly donuts. Unfortunately, Yelp won't allow me to keep it that short, so I'll also mention the beer selection, pool table, and music. You could conceivably go to a place, get some pork belly donuts, wash it down with a delicious beer while playing pool and listening to decent music. That place is The Willows.
author: Eric E.

description:
This bar just opened about six blocks from me, and it might be a new favorite.  Pool table, board games, jukebox, and lots of large tables.  Really chill and fun vibe.

There's also two bars, one that's a fully stocked cocktail bar, and the other that deals only in craft beers.  I've never had a cocktail, but the craft beer selection is a lot of fun -- I'm no beer connoisseur, but I get a kick out of trying lots of random new beers.  The food is also pretty good, as should be expected from the team at The Sycamore in the Mission.  Burger and fries were excellent.

Service was great.  The bartender, an older guy with glasses, was friendly without being chatty.  They did forget my friend's burger, but apologized profusely, brought me out a new plate of fries, and bought us a round of beers.  Can't really stay mad after that.  :)
author: Matt Y.

description:
Big, open space with a billiard table and plenty of lounge seating. They have some pinball machines in the back too. Lots of great beer on tap, and the service was exceptional!  The food menu was brief but everything was really good.  Especially enjoyed the fries and provolone cheese sticks. 
Will definitely be coming back!
author: Jonathan B.

description:
I'm so stoked there is a new bar with games, space and bomb food in SOMA. My friend and I got the arugula salad and pulled pork sando, which was THE BEST FRIGGING PULLED PORK SANDO I'VE HAD IN THE CITY. Not a pulled pork connoisseur, but I'd be willing to bet money on it. 

Played pool too, which was nice because it is a brand new table. The place was pretty dead at 8:30pm on a Saturday, but I know that won't last. The Willows is well on its way to be as reputable as its sister bar The Sycamore- however this will never happen until they find a bartender who can get people drinks in under 30 minutes.... If my rating were on service alone I'd give it a hard 2 and 1/2 stars, but I have faith that this is just one of those kinks that needs to be worked out over time. 

Be back soon!
author: Colleen F.

description:
Positives: Good selection of craft beer on tap. Good atmosphere. Drink prices are pretty good too. Overall it feels like a solid bar. 

Negatives: It's around the corner from my office but we never eat there because the food is WAY overpriced for what you get. $10-$13 burgers that don't come with fries is pretty absolutely terrible. Paying an extra $5.75 for fries and an extra $1.75 for a "flight of aioli" is just plain stupid (especially when you don't just offer ranch dressing as an alternative to ketchup). Seriously, a burger and fries/aioli is $20!? I'd much rather go eat at Catheads as it is a much better deal and the food is way superior. $12 for pulled pork, Mac n Cheese, and a beverage. Seating in the back bar is pretty lame. Need more table space to set drinks down on while standing around.
author: KC F.

description: This place is awesome.  They have indulgent mozzarella sticks and great beer.  Trivia night is super fun and the board games are fun as well (though "Operation" is missing a few parts).  I read recently that they politely ask that Google Glass be removed.  There is a lot of tension in the city today and I think this is an attempt to be proactive.  Frankly, I love being told to put my cell phone far away during Trivia nights.  It's nice to unplug from everything else and simply enjoy the surroundings.
author: Jordan P.

description: Dear Willows owner & staff: it was totally unnecessary to lie to our group of 30 tonight to get our business. We would have stayed to eat, drink, play pool and board games, and generally be merry anyway. But telling us every 30 minutes that the pork belly donuts would be "ready in one hour" every 30 minutes, and finally that "they would be ready at 9:30" is just infuriating. We dropped quite a bit of money in 4.5 hours, but sadly none of us will ever go back. Way to lose our business!
author: heidiologies g.

description: Fun atmosphere. Board games, grilled cheese sandwiches, beer on tap. What more could you ask for? Decent pricing as well.
author: Ashley K.

description: We heard good things about this place but the service was awful. The bartender took 25 minutes to take our order and it was only 7pm and it wasn't even crowded! Then we all ordered food and they were out of about half of the menu. Really? At 7pm?? Get yourself together, Willows.
author: Twee L.

description: We ,3 small regular Asian women : on Saturday night we went there at 1:45 am just want to have some beer after the party , we went to the bar and try to order the beer : the bartender  skinny with a lot of tatto instant asking us  what do we want to drink he said to us " where are you guys from ? we closed " hey it still 15 mins 'till 2 am !!!! And still have the people siting at the bar and table . Stunned !!!
author: Wanida W.

description: This is more of an evening bar and I've only been here in the afternoon . The food is not that great but I've just had the burgers. The beer selection is good and they take part in beer week. So... Good bar. Not great food.
author: Jeff R.

description: This place rules.  Liz is really awesome and it's a good vibe.  Got food too.  Excellent.  Great job.
author: Whitney D.

description: Great burgers and fries! Wasn't expecting a that from a bar. Great vibes came and had lunch with a coworker and played cards a after.
author: Natasha E.

description: I've found a new favorite drink/food spot! We happened to be here on trivia night. Unfortunately I didn't participate, but I wish I had! The trivia seemed so easy! Great mix of questions, too. The bartenders rocked, the little private tables in the coves are great and the food was sooo delicious. I will be back for sure!
author: Nic E.

description: Amazing burgers!!! I'm from scaramento and its a far drive but I'm definitely coming back here again!!!!
author: Phillip M.

description: Stopped by for a bite to eat late Saturday afternoon. I came in as I saw the pictures on Yelp and wanted to try the food. However when we sat down the only menu available was the brunch menu and there was NO way of ordering from the other menu that was set to start in 30 minutes....We were hungry so we ordered. The pork belly doughnuts were AMAZING! The rest of our order was MEH, whatever. I still want to try the dinner menu so I might go back, however I will not go for brunch again.
author: Ed S.

description: checked this place out on friday for dinner.  Had a show nearby and it received 4 stars on yelp, so figured why not.  It was crowded, loud, and had very few seats.  We ordered the california and western burgers and pork belly donuts with fries.  My meal (california burger with fries and donuts) cost $26 and my friend's cost like $17.  We told ourselves these would be the most amazing burgers, especially given the price.  Neither burger was cooked medium, as advertised.  The california burger was so boring and flavorless, but I thought the western burger was ok.  The pork belly donut holes also weren't worth the $7 they cost.  I wouldn't come here again, the food was way too overpriced for what you got.  You can get a burger from super duper that is a million times better for a fraction of the cost!
author: Kevin M.

description: Meh. Even though happy hour offers quite a lot of options, the margarita was way too sour and the music was extremely lame.
author: Alan T.

description: Came for lunch on a sunny Tuesday afternoon. Immediately from entering I knew this would be a fun night spot. Solid menu, solid setup inside, solid beer selection, both tap and bottles(very nice sour selection and special reserve bottles) and solid weekly drink specials. Everything is spread out, pool table, pinball machines, board games, and a chill side bar area with an eclectic tap selection separate from the main bar and room. I ordered the lamb and fried chicken sliders, side of fries with a random white beer. First off the fries were lightly salted, peppered, and crisped to perfection. I love a good crispy fry. The lamb slider was super juicy and packed with flavor...the fried chicken slider was crispy with accompanying pickled red onions that gave it a good flavor ....makes me want to come back to try the southern fried chicken sandwich. The sliders are tiny but ordering two mix and match sliders with a side of fries was just enough. I could probably eat a dozen sliders in one sitting, each slider takes about 3-4 bites to finish. I would  suggest the menu have a set price for three mix and match sliders but non the less both were tasty. Did I mention they have pork belly donuts. Say Whaaat? Did I mention the kick ass beer selection? Rye beer on tap? Yes please!
author: Nick L.

description:
The concept is cool: one bar for cocktails and then a bar for craft beer. However, the one time I went it was nearly impossible to order a drink from the beer side. The one bartender blamed it on lack of a second person, which I was fine with. But, when the second bartender came on it was no easier to get a drink. This was a slow Sunday early evening and there were maybe twenty people in the whole bar.

The food was pretty good. Cheaper than most places for a basket of fries and a sandwich. My partner got the sloppy joe and I got the pulled pork. Both just a bit above average and could really be quite exceptional if the bun quality was just a bit better. The fries were well seasoned with salt and pepper. Satisfying with beer, so I was happy.

Pork belly "donuts" were really disgusting and I love eating crap like this. First of all, they are not donuts. They are battered chunks of pork, fried and then put into a pool of syrup. They were also really over salted with big chunks of salt.

Tap list is a nice mix of imported and domestic beer, I am always pleased with a few things that pop up there weekly and have gone out of my way to come here to try some of them.

The board games are fun and on a slow day, it's a nice place to bring a few friends and throw a few back. Though, hands down... I'd rather be in a cramped The Sycamore than in a comfortable The Willows.
author: KA K.

description:
Chose this place to meet up with some friends to play board games because 1. they have their own and 2. it`s close enough to the Caltrain so that we could walk. I like that the place is sort of split into two, with two bars, but it`s a little too loud to play board games in. I don`t know why I expected it not to be, when I drink, I apparently lose all ability to speak at a reasonable volume. However, the side where the board games and pool table are is louder than the other side, so we just took the games to the quieter side [ which has nice, cushy booths, so it`s even better.] There`s a pretty selection of games to choose from, I just wish that they maintained it better, because most of the ones we tried that came with paper/charts were filled by other people. A few things were also missing from the boxes, here and there. I had a sweet tea drink [alcoholic] and it was really good - not too sweet, which is perfect for me, but if you see the name and get it in hopes that it`s like McDonald's sweet tea or something, it`s not. 

3 stars for now, but if I come back sometime, I`d like to try some of the food, and then maybe I`ll add another star. Or take another one away, who knows.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: I'm not sure what this place is like during regular nights, but I went here for a SF Beer Club event where they had beers from Oregon and the selection was great. Bartender was on top of it and veery helpful if you didn't know much about the individual brews. Food was really good...I got their black bean burger and it was surprisingly delicious.
author: George M.

description:
This is our go-to after-work happy hour bar. The beer on tap selection is always good. There's at least 2 or 3 beers I like to try every time I go. There's also a full bar if beer is not your thing.  

It gets pretty busy on Friday nights, but it's never overly crowded. Also never too noisy so you can hold decent conversation here with co-workers and/or friends.

Also tried their loaded fries, which is delicious!
author: Shaina J.

description: Had the best time here. Craft beer room, full bar room with pool table, board games, jukebox and very very tasty food. Beef sandwich did not disappoint. Seasonal cocktail hilarious and delicious. Pork belly donuts slightly misnamed...but yummy. Bathroom looks like a dive but has auto flush and self dispensing soap.
author: Poppy C.

description: Big fan of this place.  Friendly staff, solid food options, and stiff drinks.  I like the sliders, but the Brussels Sprouts are to die for.  Lots of techies milling about, but never mind them...  :)
author: David H.

description: With bartenders like the ones found at Willows and progressive owners like Tim, the winds of change are upon the Willows and all of downtown for that matter.  Great bar!
author: Victor H.

description: Came here for a meet up group meeting on a Tuesday night. The place was very casual, good selection of drinks and bar food, the burger looked delicious (only if I did not have dinner :( ) would definitely be back to try out more drinks and have the burger!
author: Vickie Z.

description: Really enjoyed my visit here. Food was good, drinks were cheap, price was right. Big, comfortable space, plenty of room to spread out and play games in. I'll be back whenever I'm hanging around later in SOMA.
author: Allison S.

description: Great bar with delicious bar food and wonderful service! Lots of seating, pool table, buck hunter (really!) and tons of board games. Two bars - full bar and a craft beer bar! And delicious reasonably priced food. Friendly staff. Will definitely be back!
author: Alison M.

description:
I'm more of a Deli Board, or Naked Lunch, kind of guy....  For a measure of true gastropubs, look no further than Henry's in Berkeley -- Willows is no gastropub.

The folks were friendly here, but the food was complete fuckery.  Maybe if they 'like' you the food gets done correctly.  In any event, a place that acts discriminatively toward those with Google Glass is no place I choose to frequent -- and I don't either use nor own Google Glass, I just think it's reverse snobbery without the quality food to justify such an approach.
author: John A.

description: Fun place to grab a drink with friends. They also serve food so it's a good place to eat and drink.  It's on a corner that I've passed by a bizillion times and never noticed! Glad that parking is relatively easy on that stretch of 11th.
author: Natalie S.

description: They make a good, strong mai tai! I'm hurting a bit this morning, but I really enjoyed this bar. They have a lot of seating space, and a lot of things to do: board games, cards, pool table, arcade games... not to mention two bars in one (full bar with cocktails, and craft beer bar). We had the pleasure of hanging out with one of their newest bartenders, Shea, who was a sweetheart! Check this place out, don't have TOO many mai tais, and make sure you count the deck of cards before you start playing, cause it might be missing a few :)
author: Katherine R.

description: Great place to come with friends and play some games, munch on food, and have a few drinks. I had the Pulled pork sandwich and my boyfriend ordered the wings. They were both great, and good portions for the money.
author: Mona H.

description: A great neighborhood bar/restaurant, period! This is not fuck'n Bar Agricole couple blocks over -- for fu@k sake, this is the real thing, grungy, plain, great bar food, caring people and hanging out with good old friends. Keep attitudes out. You may only like it if you're in the know!!! Are you...???
author: Denis Y.

description: This is my place. Great food, craft beer, and good cocktails. Wonderful staff. Wonderful owners. Great space. I have been here probably 70 times and will keep coming back.
author: Benson M.

description: Pinball ... Board games and good food.  What else could you ask for? My only complaint is that the portions aren't that large but still awesome and delicious.
author: Jeremy R.

description: I have been vegetarian for ten years. Tonight I ordered a veggie sloppy joe at The Willows. I was served a beef one. The server said, "veggie sloppy joe?" as he served it to me, so I did not think there could be a mistake. I ate about a third of it before realizing (I initially assumed it was boca meat). When I stopped a server and asked if my meal was veggie because it seemed suspect, he was like "No, that's meat. Oh, did you order veggie?" as if it was no big deal. I'm really upset. I have been throwing up for the past 20 minutes. They did not really care. They refunded me my eight bucks as if that makes it okay. Disgusted by this business's lack of care or respect toward their customers. I literally live less than a block away. I will never set foot in this establishment ever again. If you are vegetarian and actually care about remaining so, avoid these shitty people at all costs.
author: K. E.

description: Had a really great time here. The food was excellent and the beer selection good; although they were out of what I wanted the bartender suggested a few good alternates and let me taste until I decided. Also, any bar with a great selection of board games definitely gets my vote!
author: Justine K.

description: Came here for a gathering and was fun! The place is located at the corner of folsom and 11th, close to couple of other bars nearby and has plenty of windows. Going in, there's two different bar area, and best of all, happy hour from 4-7pm!! I got a pbr for just 2$ of course i had to tip, so equates to 4$ a beer, awesomeness! They also have small bites and a pool table in there. Not only that, but also card games, how cool is that? Great place to socialize, drink and play!
author: Hao B.

description: The owners of The Sycamore (if you haven't been, you need to get your're booty on over), have done a great job with their new venue, The Willows.  A group of us went there a few nights ago and were impressed with the space.  It's huge with two spacious rooms plus a small game room.  They serve up tasty diverse morsels for veggies and non veggies at a decent price, along with some delicious cocktails and a diverse selection of hearty beers.  The service was also excellent fast and friendly.  I hope this place knocks the socks off of SOMA in the same manner that The Sycamore has warmed up the Mission.
author: Alyssa L.

description: Enjoyed their trivia night which was very fun. Tried the "lava challenge" flavour of their wings, only ate 6 and my stomach was not happy for the night, but I don't regret it.
author: XiaoChuan Y.

description: This place is killer. Great beer and booze selection and nice strong cocktails. And when you get the boozy munchies your all set. The sliders are addicting and the pork belly donuts live up to the hype. Love the deviled eggs also. The whole staff is friendly and attentive and the jukebox rolls out great tunes. You can also get your games on with pinball, buck hunter and a pool table.
author: Jorge E.

description: Checked this place out for a bite. Still looks like "Hamburger Mary's they even have the same bar and the space is really the same. Pinball Machines in the back and tables were the always were.  Had the Burger ( a tribute to Mary) good burger, but don't expect the Mary Burger.  The place is airy, relaxed casual and comfy. Met the owner , former USF staff and student.  Gets loud but really laid back. Will go back , friendly staff. Check it out, you will get nostalgic for Mary's or Cissy's Salon.
author: Susie S.

description: The bartenders are super friendly and service is quick. Great beer selection. Get the pork belly donuts! They're heaven.
author: Sara R.

description: This place has everything you need: good food, drinks, games, a lot of open space, pool, and a jukebox. Going to become a regular.
author: Scott A.

description: Love The Sycamore so could only expect imagine good things. I wasn't disappointed. I totally love this new place AND it's closer to my house. Great staff, yummy food, drinks to quench your thirst and a ton of games to boot. What's not to like?
author: Joanna R.

description: It's hard yo find decent vegetarian burgers but the black beans burger was awesome! Great beers and great food at a great location!
author: Mariana S.

description: Love this place!  I've been here 4 times and love the awesome beers on tap enjoy the full bar option.  The bacon cheeseburger and fries I had on visit #2 was great too!  I even got to be a Mullet Store Owner and Wheelchair Stealer playing the Redneck Life board game they have in stock.  Oh, and Liz and Tim are 2 of the nicest restaurant/bar owners in town!  Highly recommend!
author: Luke L.

description: I'm only giving 1 star for their service! Food and drinks are awesome!!! However the bartender/server josh is horrible! He definitely looks like he hates what he does! Asked him for service and he looked at me and looked away?!! Really?!! We walked over to him and then he tells us we have  to order up front with him! Ordered few drinks and just gave us a really uncomfortable look! We are now thinking to go elsewhere for better service!
author: E E.

description:
I walk by here on my way to the parking garage around the corner and finally decided to stop by for lunch one day. Yes, their "big ass burgers" are definitely that. I came here hungry around 2 pm and saw the ad. didn't quite believe it. My coworker and I each ordered a burger, fries, drinks. Yea, we couldn't move after wolfing down the food. So good.

They also have an awesome happy hour. This place is always bumping. Lots of space, board games, billiards, people. It's great. And sometimes there's "mystery" shots for $3. Haha! Who can say no to that?!
author: Matt T.

description: I had the burger. I found it overpriced and greasy. I was sitting at the bar and kept having customers coming up behind me and reaching over my shoulder to get drinks because the bartenders don't enforce or have a bar station. Overall lackluster.
author: Casey E.

description:
It's clear immediately after walking in that this wasn't whoever designed this joint's first rodeo. The decor is understated but somehow manages to be warm at the same time. I came in for my first visit on a Wednesday evening and got a delicious "Tish" -fesh tasting peach martini. I then discovered the beer (and shots!) bar in the second room. They have a *very* well selected beer menu, and that's a tall order for someone who works in a brewery.
I loved that there was a large table of people playing cards against humanity and the corner location with all windows on two sides gets great afternoon light. The service was prompt and friendly on both sides and  I'm looking forward to returning and trying some munchies! Extra points for the big jukebox and arcade games, and the fact that almost all the other patrons looked like people I might enjoy chatting with.
author: Madelyn M.

description: Having a slow Sunday getting out of bed?  Last night's party left you with an appetite that demands RIGHT NOW but you dread the idea of battling the Sunday brunch crowds?  Willows saves the day with this dilemma-  not only is parking a breeze (take that Mission!), but the food service starts at 1pm on Sundays.  Perfect for brunching on little sliders and a bloody mary!  And really- bring your friends.  You can play Cards Against Humanity while your brain wakes up and you wait for your food.
author: Jessie'sGirl m.

description: Good beer selection.  Happy hour food selections are limited, and though the price is good, they make up for it in smallish portions.  If you're hungry, just order off the regular menu.  Watch out on your bill -- I ordered a happy hour slider combo that supposedly came with fries.  They forgot the fries, and when I pointed it out, they brought the missing fries, but charged me.  It's not worth fighting over $1.75, but I probably won't be going back, either.
author: Matthew G.

description:
The best bar to hit the lower Soma area since Bar Agricole - and way less expensive/hip!

I love Bar Agricole - but I've slowly seen their average drink prices creep up from $8-10, to a solid $12-15... which is well worth their quality, but makes it harder to stomach fighting through the crowds.

The willows is fun, good beer selection, unpretentious menu, great deviled eggs, and how can you get mad at BOARD GAMES?

I hope that this place stays for the long run - we need a midpoint between Butter and Bar Agricole in this cozy part of Soma.
author: Vivek S.

description: I LOVE this place. The drinks, food, and music are all awesome. The pork belly doughnuts are a must-try. There are two bars in the space. One serves craft beer. The other serves cocktails and mixed drinks (and limited beer selection). I actually really like this set-up especially since the two rooms have slightly different vibes. The people here are great.
author: Mr. X.

description: badass bar with cave like seating & yum food
author: Sonya Z.

description: Great beer selection, and awesome bar food. Love the pool table and pinball machines.
author: Clifford M.

description: Great bar with great beer and a great atmosphere. The front room has a nice selection of craft beer that is constantly changing. The back room has a full bar and a number of board games for any and all to play, as well as pinball machines, pool table and a jukebox. It's never too crowded whenever I've been on weekend nights and just a great place to hang out and get a drink.
author: Stephen C.

description: This place is AWESOME!  Great selection of local craft beer and really solid cocktail menu.  The staff is very friendly.  Love the decor and the fact that they have pool tables.  Food is great!  Definitely check out the pork belly doughnuts and mac n' cheese balls!
author: g k.
